"Go *change*, love." She slips free of my grip, gentle but firm. "Please. I want to see youâ€”" Her voice catches. "Just go change. We can talk later."

I let her go.

What else can I do?]I don't ask.

Part of me wants toâ€”the part that's still Aldric, still the protector, still the one who needs to *know* every threat to his beloved. But there's another part now, newer and more cowardly, that whispers: *If you don't ask, you don't have to know. Elara can handle herself.*

"Thank you," I say.

Elara's shoulders relax slightly. She squeezes my hand once, quick and grateful, before turning toward the cookfire with the hares.

"Go on," she says. "The smallclothes are there too."

I strip out of the bikini armor with hands that tremble.

The metal comes away reluctantly, like it's *disappointed* to release me. The triangles peel from my nipples with a soft pull that makes me wince. The thong... I have to reach back and actually *pull* it free from where it's wedged, and the sensation of that metal strip sliding out from between my cheeks is something I will never, *ever* get used to.

I stand there for a moment, naked in the dim light of the hut, and just *breathe*.

Then Elara's voice floats through the hide-flap: "The long ones are like braies, they tie at the waist."

"I'll figure it out."

The cotton settles against my skin like a benediction.

It's not that the fabric hides what I've becomeâ€”my breasts still *move* beneath the blouse, their weight unmistakable, their shape obvious through the thin material. The breeches still strain over hips that are far too wide. But I'm *covered*. Truly covered, for the first time in days.

The boots are slightly too small.

Elara's feet are even daintier than mine, apparently. When I work my toes into the leather, when I stand and feel the flat solid *ground* beneath me instead of those hellish spike heels...

I want to cry.[Choice: Join them at the cookfire.

passages.name: 04 meal
passages.label: Meal
passages.text:
[Image: 'The clothes are *hers* now.'
The rabbits sizzle over the flame, stuffed with wild herbs that Elara brought from home. It cuts through the perpetual goblin-stink of this place.

Snib squats on a flat stone beside the fire pit, his loincloth doing its inadequate work, his yellow eyes tracking between me and Elara with an expression that makes my skin crawl.

"NICE getup," he says as I settle onto a stone across from him. "Real PRETTY."

Elara doesn't look up from turning the spit.

"The clothes are *hers* now." Her voice is flat. Controlled. "She deserves to wear them."

"Oh, AYE. She DESERVES all sorts of things." Snib's grin widens. "Lucky fer her, I'm a GENEROUS master."

The collar hums against my throat.

I watch Elara's hands as she works. The quick, competent movements of a woman who's spent years preparing meals for a household. The way she's already claimed this cookfire as *hers*, organizing the space around it, finding efficiency in chaos.

She's good at this. Taking control of environments. Making order from disorder.

"I found some roots growing near the well. And I saved the liversâ€”they're good for iron, you needâ€”" She catches herself. Swallows. "You need to keep your strength up."

The meal, when it comes, is the best thing I've eaten since the transformation. Tender rabbit, herb-crusted and perfectly cooked, with roasted roots that are bitter but satisfying. Elara serves us both before taking her own portion, moving around the fire with the ease of long practice.

I eat in the clothes my wife gave me, my feet flat on the ground, my body covered in soft cotton, and I try to ignore the way Snib's eyes keep drifting to Elara's chest.

"Good GRUB, missus!" He tears into his portion with greasy fingers. "Keep cookin' like THIS, and maybe I'll let hero-cunt wear clothes MORE often!"

Elara's hand tightens on her bowl.

"How generous of you," she grinds out.[Choice: Evening approaches.

passages.name: 04 evening settle
passages.label: Evening Settle
passages.text:
"Right then!" Snib stretches on his fur pile, scratching his belly with theatrical satisfaction. "Same rules as last night, ladies. NAKED. Both of ye." His yellow eyes gleam in the dying light. "Unless the missus wants to renegotiate?"

Elara's hands freeze on the bowl she's scrubbing.

"No," she says. "The deal stands."

We undress in silenceâ€”me peeling away the cotton blouse that felt like freedom, Elara unlacing her bodice with mechanically. Neither of us looks at the other. Neither of us looks at Snib, though I can *feel* his gaze crawling over our skin like flies on meat.

We pray together.

"What's this EFFEMMERALLS?" Snib's voice cuts through the darkness. "Them... what's it..."

I don't answer. Elara's body has gone rigid against mine.

"See, HERE'S the thing." He shifts on his furs. "Ye're in SNIB'S house now. Under SNIB'S roof. And in Snib's house..." He chucklesâ€”a sound like gravel in phlegm. "...we follow STORAK."

"We don't worship yourâ€”" Elara starts.

The collar *thwumps*. I squeeze her hand.

"Ain't askin' ye to WORSHIP, missus." His grin is audible. "Just... acknowledgin' the situation, like. Yer *wife*â€”" he says with obvious relish, "â€”she's wearin' my collar. So she's bound by my laws. And ye know, it's simple! Storak's got only ONE commandment, see?"

He pauses. Waits for us to ask.

passages.name: 04 storak
passages.label: Storak
passages.text:
"What commandment?" The words escape before I can stop them. Why am I humoring him?

Snib's cackle fills the hut.

"SPREAD THE SEED!" He slaps his thigh, delighted. "That's the whole RELIGION! Storak says: find cunts, fill 'em, make more gobbos!" Another wet laugh. "Yer fancy gods with their HOURGLASSES and their DOORS... what do THEY want? Ye to REMEMBER things? To CHANGE things?" He hawks and spits into the darkness. "Storak wants one thing. And he GETS it. Every time a gobbo nuts in a humie, that's PRAYER. Every spawn that pops out, that's WORSHIP."

Elara's nails dig into my forearm.

"Storak's WINNIN'," Snib continues, warming to his sermon. "More gobbos every year. More cunts full of gobbo goo. More broodmamas prayin' to HIM by the end, beggin' for another load..."

"Stop." Elara's voice is barely a whisper.

"Oh, I'll stop." The fur pile rustles as he settles back. "Got twenty-nine more days. Tonight..." He yawns obscenely. "Tonight, who cares?"

The silence stretches.

"G'night, cunts."]I say nothing. Let him talk. Let his words wash over me like the stink of this placeâ€”acknowledged, endured, survived.

Snib chuckles.

The fur pile rustles as he makes himself comfortable.

"See, yer fancy gods..." His voice drops to something almost philosophicalâ€”the collar's gift of intelligence turning crude into cruel. "Storak don't want none of that thrakkin' stuff they want. Storak just wants SEED in CUNTS. And ye know what?"

He pauses. The silence begs for someone to fill it.

"Storak WINS. Every time. 'Cause thinkin' and choosin'... that takes EFFORT. Bodies do what bodies DO. Yer wife's body..." He trails off meaningfully. "Well. She knows what I mean, don't she?"

I feel her flinch.

"G'night, titcow. G'night, missus." The sounds of him settling. Then, almost as an afterthought: "Twenty-nine days left. Plenty of time for PRAYER."

Elara's hand gropes through the dark and locks around mine. Fierce. Desperate.

"I love you," she whispers.

The words sound different than yesterday.

[Image: I hold my wife. Feel her heartbeat against my palm.

I hold my wife. Feel her heartbeat against my palm.[Choice: Close your eyes...

passages.name: 04 day3 grooming
passages.label: Day3 Grooming
passages.text:
The curry comb is a sorry thingâ€”a flat stone.

I drag it down Jarkrond's flank for the hundredth time.

"This is absurd," I mutter to no one. The ash-runner's grey hide ripples beneath the stone's passage, muscle shifting under skin like snakes beneath silk. "As if you give a damn about your *appearance*. You live around thrakking *goblins*."

Jarkrond's ear swivels toward me. Those amber eyes track my reflection in the well-water.

Behind me, the hut squats against its dead tree. Smoke curls from the chimney hole. Elara is in there. With *him*.

My jaw tightens.

*You do the hunting, hero-cunt. Missus does the cooking. You groom Jarko. Missus mends the roof-thatch. You haul water. Missusâ€”*

Always *missus*. Always Elara, alone with him, while I'm sent to the far corners of his miserable territory.

The wool of my breeches clings to my thighs, damp with sweat. The cotton blouseâ€”*real clothes*, thank the Triadâ€”has gone translucent where it plasters against my chest, the fabric darkening in a V between my breasts. I can feel the moisture pooling in the hollow of my collarbone, trickling down to disappear into the valley of my cleavage.

This body *sweats*. Profusely. Constantly. As if designed to glisten.

I drag the comb down Jarkrond's barrel, working the dust from his coat in long strokes. His hide is fever-warm beneath my touch, radiating heat like sun-baked stone. When I lean close to reach his withers, something *thick* fills my nostrils.

It's... salty. Grassy, but also deeper. Like copper left too long in summer rain.

I jerk my head back.

*Focus. Just finish this and get back to her.*

"Ye missin' a spot, cow-tits."

I don't turn around.

"Go away, Snib," I manage. The collar permits it, as it shares my master's amusement.

"Awww, and here I thought ye'd be GRATEFUL." His shadow falls across my work, three feet of it grotesquely elongated by the sun. "Givin' ye a break from the HARD labor. Lettin' ye spend time with Jarko here."

"Where's Elara?"

"Busy." The word drips satisfaction. "Very busy. Woman's work, ye know."

I keep brushing. Long strokes. Even pressure. Don't let him see how the question burns in my chest.

"What kind of work?"

"Oh, this and that." I hear him scratch himself. The sound is *wet*. "Cleanin'. Organizin'. She's got CLEVER hands, that one. Real good with 'em."

The comb stutters against Jarkrond's hide.

passages.name: 04 grope
passages.label: Grope
passages.text:
I don't give him the satisfaction of a reaction.

"Ye know what I like about ye, hero-cunt?"

I don't answer. Don't engage.

"YER ARSE."

His hand *cracks* against my backside without warningâ€”a full-armed swing that sends my body lurching forward, my palms slapping against Jarkrond's flank for balance. ]I turnâ€”

â€”and his warty hand *cracks* across my ass before I can register the movement.

"Look at THAT!" Snib cackles, and I feel his stubby fingers grip a handful of my ass through the fabric. He *kneads* it like bread dough, his claws pricking through the wool. "Ye could bounce a gold piece off that, ye could! Too bad ye don't got enough..."

The collar vibrates against my throat.

Jarkrond's head swings around. Those amber eyes find Snib's hand on my body.

"Oi, JARKYSKINS." Snib releases me with a final *squeeze* and waddles around to face the stallion. He jabs a stubby finger at the horse's muzzle. "Don't ye go gettin' IDEAS, boy. This arseâ€”" He gestures back at me. "â€”belongs to SNIB. These titsâ€”" Another gesture. "â€”belong to SNIB. This whole bouncy, jiggly, hero-shaped FUCKTOY belongs to SNIB."

Jarkrond's nostrils flare.

"UNLESSâ€”" Snib's broken-toothed grin spreads. "â€”unless ye ask REAL nice. Then maybeâ€”MAYBEâ€”I might let ye have a turn."

He cackles at his own joke and waddles back toward the hut.

"Keep brushin', titcow! Says 'e wants to be GLEAMING!"

The hide-flap swallows him.

I stand there, my ass still stinging from the impact, and stare at the smoke rising from the chimney.

*Elara.*

The curry comb feels heavy in my hand.[Choice: Continue grooming.

passages.name: 04 underbelly
passages.label: Underbelly
passages.text:
I circle to Jarkrond's other side.

His near flank is doneâ€”grey hide gleaming dully in the afternoon light, free of the dust that accumulates in these endless sands. Now the far side. Then his legs. Then hisâ€”

*Underbelly*.

I hesitate.

Horses need their underbellies groomed like any other part. Aldric did this a hundred times with war-mounts. It's nothing. It's *routine*.

I crouch beside him, the worn stone warm in my palm, and begin working the dust from his barrel where it curves beneath his chest.

The scent is stronger here. Each stroke of the comb releases more of it from his hideâ€”that thick, *living* smell that seems to bypass my nose entirely and settle directly into the base of my skull. My nipples stiffen against the damp cotton of my blouse before I can stop them, two points of sensation I didn't ask for, don't want, can't seem to control.

*It's just a horse. It's just GROOMING. This body reacts to everything.*

I work the comb lower, into the shadow of his belly, the sensitive skin where forelegs meet trunk.

I freeze.

From his sheathâ€”that sweat-darkened leather pouch slung between his hindlegsâ€”the beast is emerging. Pink-grey and glistening, mottled with darker patches where blood pulses beneath the surface. It slides out inch by inch, wet and heavy and *thick*, until it hangs there, half-erect, swinging gently with the rhythm of his heartbeat.

The head alone is larger than my fist, flared and blunt and weeping something clear that catches the light before dripping onto the sand.

[Image: right]
I should look away.

I should *definitely* look away.

But my eyes are fixed on itâ€”on the way the veins pulse beneath the mottled skin, on the way the heat radiates off it in visible waves, on the way it *twitches* as if aware of my attention.

Jarkrond's head turns. Those amber eyes pin me where I crouch.

passages.name: 04 brush choice
passages.label: Brush Choice
passages.text:
*Horses drop when they're relaxed. It means nothing. It's NOTHING.*

I force my eyes back to the comb. To his hide. To the *task*.

My strokes are shorter now. Quicker. I'm working around the area, avoiding theâ€”the *thing* swinging in my peripheral vision, but I'm still *working*. Just doing what Snib ordered.

This is just grooming. This is just a horse being a horse. This body reacts to *everything*, and that doesn't mean anything, and the fact that my thighs are pressing together of their own accord is justâ€”justâ€”

I finish his sides. Move to his legs. Keep my head down.

When I finally back away, Jarkrond's cock is *fully* erect nowâ€”curved upward against his belly, the head kissing his own grey hide, leaving a wet smear of something that glistens in the sun.

He watches me walk back toward the hut.]I scramble backward.

The curry comb tumbles from my fingers into the sand. My heel catches on a buried root and I nearly fall, catching myself on the well.

"I'mâ€”" The word comes out strange. "I'm done. You're... you're groomed enough."

Jarkrond makes a sound.

His cock twitches onceâ€”twiceâ€”then begins the slow process of retreating into its sheath. The wet *schlurp* of its withdrawal follows me as I turn and walkâ€”*don't run, don't RUN*â€”toward the hut.

I don't look back.

But I feel his eyes on me the whole way.[Choice: Go back inside.

passages.name: 04 go inside
passages.label: Go Inside
passages.text:
The hide-flap parts under my hand.

Inside, Elara looks up from the cookfire with a smile that doesn't quite reach her eyes.

"You're back early," she says.

Snib, sprawled on his fur pile, just grins.[Choice: Evening falls...

passages.name: 04 day3 evening
passages.label: Day3 Evening
passages.text:
"Hold still."

Elara's fingers are gentle on my forearm, wrapping the linen strip around the gash where a thornbush caught me while stalking the rabbit. The cut isn't deep, but it bled freely.

Soot smudges one cheekbone. The top button of her blouse hangs open, revealing the hollow of her throat.

"There." She ties off the bandage and lifts my arm to inspect her work. "Keep it clean. I'll check it tomorrow."

"Thank you."

"I'm sorry about the rabbit," I say. "I'll try to catch more tomorrow. You must be hungry."

"It's *fine*." She's already turning back to the cookfire, where the skinned carcass turns on a makeshift spit. "Tomorrow, try the eastern dunes. Snib says there are thornback bushes that wayâ€”"

"Snib *says*?"

"He knows this area." She's measuring every syllable like medicine. "He lives here. And I need desert sage if I'm going to keep this place from giving us lung-rot. The smoke-hole was completely clogged when we arrived, did you know that? I had toâ€”"

She's talking too fast.

I watch her stir something in the small pot she brought from homeâ€”herbs steeping in well-water, their fragrance cutting through the ever-present goblin musk. Above the fire, bundles of dried plants hang from cords she's strung between the support posts. The straw pile where we sleep has been refreshed, the old stalks replaced with new ones.

She's *nesting*.

passages.name: 04 clover talk
passages.label: Clover Talk
passages.text:
"How's... Clover?"

Elara's hands still on the spit.

"I... checked on her." She doesn't turn around. "While you were out."

"And?"

"She's..." A long breath. "She's not fighting him anymore. Jarkrond. She just... stands there. Lets him..." Another breath. "She used to stamp and toss her head when stallions came near. Remember? At the spring market, when Lord Aldworth's stud got loose?"

I remember. Clover had nearly kicked the stable door down.

"Now she just..." Elara's voice cracks. "She's changing."

The fire crackles between us.

"Mares that are bred by ash-runners," she says quietly. "I've read about it. They're never the same afterward. Something in the... in the seed. It changes them. Makes them *want*â€”"

She stops. Her shoulders are shaking.

"Maybe we should let her go." The words come out rough. "Open the lean-to. Let her find her way back to Eboncrest."

"But then how would *we* get back?"

Elara turns. Her eyes are red-rimmed, but her jaw is set.

"On foot," she says.]I move to help her with the cooking.

Our hands brush as I take the spit from her gripâ€”my fingers too soft, too *small* against hers. I'm used to fully enclosing hers. She lets me turn the rabbit while she tends to the pot, and for a moment we work in silence, side by side, almost like we're back in our cottage.

"You've made it nicer in here," I say. "Much nicer."

She glances around at her work.

"Someone had to." Her voice is flat. "The smellâ€”" She shakes her head. "I couldn't just sit here and do nothing while you were out hunting."

"OI!"

Snib's voice cuts through the moment like a blade through silk.

He waddles in from somewhereâ€”gods know where he wasâ€”and throws himself onto his fur pile like a king returning from war. His loincloth rises, then falls.

"That smells BOOYAGH, missus!" He sniffs the air loudly, wetly. "Better than that slop Elise was makin' me!"

Elara's spine stiffens.

"Thank you," she says. The words sound like they're being pulled from her with tongs.

"See, THAT'S what I like!" Snib scratches his balls with one hand, picking his teeth with the other. "A female what knows her PLACE. Cookin'. Cleanin'. Keepin' the hut nice for her MASTER."

The collar nestles against my throat.

"She's not YOURâ€”" I start, then stop.[Choice: Eat.

passages.name: 04 meal together
passages.label: Meal Together
passages.text:
The rabbit is small.

Elara and I share what's left.

She gives me the larger portion without asking, and I try to give it back, and we do this small dance until she fixes me with a look that says *eat it or I'll force it down your throat myself*.

I eat.

"Ye need to catch MORE tomorrow, titcow," Snib announces through a mouthful of meat. "One bunny ain't gonna feed three mouths. Wellâ€”" He grins. "â€”two mouths and a CUNT what eats like a bird."

"There was only one in the burrow," I manage, tamping down anger. "And I need a better BOW, mine broke again, cutting my..."

"S'alright." Elara's hand lands on my knee under the low table she's constructed from scavenged planks. "Tomorrow you can set snares. I'm sure you'll catch more that way."

"SNARES!" Snib cackles. "Missus knows her CRAFT, don't she? Real wilderness WIFE. Bet she could survive out here even without ol' Snib to protect her."

Elara's grip tightens on my knee.

"Though, she'd miss me something AWFUL, wouldn't ye, missus?"

Silence.

"Give us a word, then," Snib prompts. "Go on. Show yer wifey what ye learned today."

My blood runs cold.

Elara's cheeks flush. Her jaw works.

[Image: left]
"*Gruk-thrak*," she says quietly.

The word hits me like a physical blow. I know that word. Every warrior who's fought goblins knows that wordâ€”it's their most basic affirmation, their *yes*, their *I understand and comply*.

"See?" Snib beams. "She's LEARNIN'! Give her a bit more and she'll be chatterin' away like a properâ€”"

"*Shut up*." Elara's voice is ice.

The collar doesn't even twitch.

Snib just laughs.[Choice: Later, while cleaning up...

passages.name: 04 after meal
passages.label: After Meal
passages.text:
"Elara."

She doesn't look up.

"That word. The Goblish."

"It's just practical." Her voice is too bright. Too controlled. "If I can communicate basic things, he's less likely to... misunderstand. And if he misunderstands..."

*The collar punishes ME.*

"I know." I set down the bowl. Cross to where she's kneeling by the fire. "I know you're trying to protect me. I know everything you do is forâ€”"

"Don't." She holds up a hand. "Please. I can'tâ€”I can't do this right now."

I kneel beside her anyway. Take her hand in mine.

"You smell like horse," she says softly.

"I know."

"You should wash. Before bed."

"Elaraâ€”"

I lean in. Press my lips to hers.

[Image: For a momentâ€”one perfect, aching momentâ€”she kisses me back.

For a momentâ€”one perfect, aching momentâ€”she kisses me back.

Then she pulls away.

"Not here." Her voice is barely a whisper. "He's *watching*."

I don't turn to look at Snib's fur pile. Don't need to.

I can feel his yellow eyes on us like hands.[Choice: The next day...

passages.name: 04 day4 nightmare
passages.label: Day4 Nightmare
passages.text:
The window of our cottage frames them like a portrait.

Inside, Elara buckles armor onto Snib's shoulders.

He stands on a stool to reach her height, his warty green flesh squeezed into plate that gleams brightly. *My* armor. My helm. She adjusts the pauldrons with the same careful fingers that once dressed wounds on my body, and her face wears an expression I cannot read.

"Higher, missus," Snib's voice slithers through the glass. "Snib's shoulders ain't quite the same as yer hubby's."

She laughs.

The sound pierces me deep. I hammer on the windowâ€”*Elara! ELARA!*â€”but my fists make no sound, or perhaps the glass swallows it, or perhaps I have no fists at all.

Snib turns.

"Oi, titcow!" His grin splits his face like a wound tearing open. "Ye can WATCH if ye want! Might learn somethin' about how a REAL hero gets dressed!"

Elara's hands pause on his helm.

She looks toward the window.

Through me.

*Past* me.

"Who are you talking to, love?"[Choice: Wake up.

passages.name: 04 waking
passages.label: Waking
passages.text:
My eyes snap open.

Darkness. The reek of goblin. Straw scratching against bare skin.

*Dream. Just a dream. Just aâ€”*

My hand reaches sideways to find empty space.

My heart seizes.

I push myself upright, breasts swaying with the motion, and my gaze cuts through the pre-dawn murk toward Snib's fur pile. The shape there is small. Singular. His wet snores rattle the fetid air.

*Where is she?*

Something crashes outside.A horse's screamâ€”high and panicked, the sound of an animal in distress.

I'm moving before I think. The hide tears aside under my hand and the desert night hits me like a wall of cold silk, and I'm *running*, bare feet slapping packed sand, collar bouncing against my throat, everything exposed to the stars and the wind and whatever waits in the darknessâ€”

*Elara. ELARA.*

The lean-to looms ahead. Torchlight flickers from withinâ€”one of our travel torches, guttering in its makeshift bracket. Jarkrond's massive shape rears against the glow, forelegs pawing air, a sound tearing from his throat that's more fury than fear.

And thereâ€”

*There*â€”

Elara stands at the lean-to's entrance, her nightgown pale as bone in the torchlight, her hands raised toward the thrashing stallion.

Beyond her, through the gap in the fence she's torn open, a white shape gallops into the darkness.

Clover.[Choice: 'ELARA!'

passages.name: 04 confrontation
passages.label: Confrontation
passages.text:
She spins. Her face is wetâ€”tears tracking silver down her cheeksâ€”and her eyes go wide as she takes in the sight of me.

"Eliseâ€”you'reâ€”you need to go back inside, you're notâ€”"

"What are you *DOING*?"

Jarkrond screams again. His hooves crash down inches from where I stand, and I feel the impact through my bare soles, feel sand spray against my shins and thighs and the soft expanse of my belly.

I grab his lead-rope without thinking.

"*EASY!*" The word tears from my throat in Aldric's voice, or as close as this body can manage. I haul on the rope with both hands, throwing my weight backward, and Jarkrond's head jerks down. "*Easy*, damn you!"

He fights me. Muscles bunch beneath grey hide. His amber eyes roll, showing white, and that sound keeps coming from his chestâ€”a keeningâ€”the grief-sound of a beast denied its mate.

[Image: 'She's GONE!'
"She's GONE!" I shout at him. "She's *gone*, you monster!"

His head swings toward me.

The rage bleeds from his posture like water from a cracked vessel. His nostrils flare onceâ€”twiceâ€”drinking in something from the air around my naked flesh.

He stills.

The cold night air bites every inch of me. My breasts heave with exertion, nipples stiff and aching in the chill. The weight of my hips, my ass, my *everything*, bare and undefended beneath the predawn stars.

Jarkrond's gaze travels down my body with deliberate, *intelligent* attention.[Choice: Turn to Elara.

passages.name: 04 clover gone
passages.label: Clover Gone
passages.text:
I release the lead-rope.

Jarkrond doesn't move. Just stands there, breathing, *watching*. I turn my back on himâ€”every instinct screaming that this is wrong, and cross to where Elara stands at the broken fence.

The desert stretches before us, vast and dark, the eastern horizon just beginning to blush with the promise of dawn. Somewhere out there, a white shape grows smaller and smaller against the dunes.

"I couldn't let her stay." Elara's voice is raw. "I couldn't watch her... Ugh. I just couldn't!"

I take her hand. Her fingers are ice.

"She was mine." A sob breaks through. "Before any of this. Fed her from a bottle when her mother died. And now..."

"You saved her."

"Just one innocent thing. One creature who didn't choose this, who didn'tâ€”" Her voice cracks. "Who still had a chance to run."

"We can run too," I say quietly. "Right now. Just... walk into the dark. Find our way back toâ€”"

"The collar."

Two words. They fall like stones into still water.

"You could walk to the edge of the world and you'd still be *his*," Elara continues. Her voice has steadied somehow, found that iron core. "Still feel it when he calls. Still..."

She doesn't need to finish.[Choice: Watch Clover disappear.

passages.name: 04 dawn together
passages.label: Dawn Together
passages.text:
The first true light of dawn breaks over the eastern dunes.

The sky above shifts from black to purple to a blue so pale it's almost white, and against it, the last glimpse of Clover's white coat flickers once, twice, and is gone.

"She'll find her way back." Elara's voice is barely a whisper. "Horses always know how to find home."

"So do we."

She turns to look at me.

In the dawn light, her face is stripped of everything but the truth. The exhaustion. The fear. The love that burns beneath it all, stubborn and fierce and refusing to die no matter how many indignities this place heaps upon us.

Her eyes travel down my bodyâ€”taking in the nakedness I'd forgotten in my panic, the curves and softnesses that aren't *mine*, the collar that marks me as property. Her expression cracks. Painâ€”and beneath it, something hungrier.

"You're beautiful," she says softly.

"Don't."

"I mean it." Her hand rises. Touches my cheek. Her palm is warmer now, or perhaps the dawn has warmed us both. "I look at you and I see *you*. Not what the collar wants. Just... Aldric. My Aldric. Wearing borrowed flesh."

"Flesh that isn't mine."

"Flesh that I love." She steps closer. Her nightgown brushes against my bare skin. "Because you're inside it. Because every morning you wake up and you *choose* to keep fighting. Because you haven't given up."

"Neither have you."

Something flickers behind her eyes.

"We should go inside." She's pulling away now. "Before he wakes. Before he sees... he won't be happy about Clover. But... I'll talk him down."

I take her hand before she can retreat completely.

"Twenty-seven days," I say. "And then we go home. We *both* go home. Whatever happens between now and then... we face it together. Yes?"

Her grip tightens.

Behind us, Jarkrond stamps once in the lean-to.[Choice: Later...

passages.name: 04 snib rage
passages.label: Snib Rage
passages.text:
"WHAT."

Snib's whole body has gone rigidâ€”warty fists clenched at his sides, the tendons in his neck standing out like cords.

"What," he repeats, softer now, "have ye DONE."

"I let her go." Elara's voice doesn't waver. She stands between me and the goblin, shoulders squared, chin lifted. "She didn't deserveâ€”"

He spins, jabbing a stubby finger at Elara, then at me, then at the empty lean-to where only Jarkrond remains.

"Yeâ€”ye justâ€”ye SENT HER AWAY? Without askin'? Without so much as a BY-YER-LEAVE to the gobbo what OWNS this whole thrakking OPERATION?"

The collar *clamps*.

I drop to my knees, hands flying to my throat. The iron grinds my windpipe. Pressure floods behind my eyes.

"Snibâ€”" I gasp.

"DON'T ye 'Snib' me, titcow!" He's pacing now, his loincloth swinging with each furious step, his cock already beginning to chub beneath the fabric. "I been GOOD to ye! Both of ye! Let ye sleep TOGETHER, didn't I? Let ye wear CLOTHES when ye earned it! Fed ye from me own stores!"

"Your stores are things *we* caughtâ€”" Elara starts.

"IRRELEVANT!" Snib wheels on her. Spittle flies from his lips. "This is ME territory! ME rules! And yeâ€”" He jabs at her again. "â€”ye just DANCE in here with yer fancy HERBS and yer ATTITUDE and ye think ye can do whatever ye WANT?"[Choice: Watch helplessly.

passages.name: 04 rage escalate
passages.label: Rage Escalate
passages.text:
"Jarko was HAPPY!" Snib's voice cracks on the word. He clutches at his chest, eyes rolling toward the lean-to where Jarkrond stands watching with unsettling calm. "Finally had a COMPANION! Someone to SHARE things with! And ye justâ€”ye justâ€”"

He snarls, wet and cracked, a sob buried in it.

"Took her away from him! Like she was NOTHIN'! Like Jarko's FEELINS' don't MATTER!"

The collar eases slightly. I suck in air, still kneeling in the sand, watching this... *performance*.

"Maybeâ€”" Snib's voice drops, goes silky-dangerous. "Maybe this ain't WORKIN' OUT. Havin' the missus here. Thought she'd be HELPFUL, but all she does is CAUSE PROBLEMS."

Elara's face goes white.

"Perhaps I should send her BACK to humie-town. Let her walk. A jaunt through the Sandsâ€”bit rough fer a soft city female, but she'd probably SURVIVE. And then it'd just be ME and titcow here. Nice and COZY. Plenty of QUALITY TIME."

"No." The word tears from Elara's throat. "No, I'llâ€”I'll fix this. I'll go find Clover, I'll bring her backâ€”"

"TOO LATE fer that, missus." Snib examines his claws with elaborate disinterest. "Mare's GONE. Jarko's LONELY. Someone's gotta PAY fer that."

His eyes find mine. Then slide to Elara.

"Unless..."[Choice: Oh gods...

passages.name: 04 elara deal
passages.label: Elara Deal
passages.text:
"Unless WHAT?" Elara's voice is steady, but I can see her hands trembling at her sides.

Snib's grin splits his face.

"Well NOW." He waddles closer to herâ€”close enough that she'd have to look down to meet his eyes, close enough that I can see her nostrils flare at his proximity. "Been thinkin', missus. Ye got somethin' I been wantin' to... *examine*."

"Not as big as yer WIFEY'S, mind. But they got a certain... CHARM. Nice and NATURAL. Bit of BOUNCE to 'em." He makes a cupping gesture with both hands. "Just a little FEEL. Wouldn't take but a MOMENT."

Elara's jaw works.

"ELARAâ€”" I try to rise. The collar *wrenches* me back down.

"You'll FORGET about Clover," she continues, ignoring me. "No more talk of sending me away. No more *punishments* for something that's already done."

Snib's grin widens. His loincloth strains visibly nowâ€”the fabric drawing forward, the outline of that massive shaft basically having a cloth draped over it. I watch Elara's eyes flicker down. Watch them widen. Watch them snap back up to his face.

"Ye drive a HARD bargain, missus." He cackles at his own joke. "Just a TOUCH. Nice and GENTLE-like."

passages.name: 04 revelation choice
passages.label: Revelation Choice
passages.text:
"STOP!"

The word tears out of me. The collar *convulses*, and I feel tears streaming down my cheeks as I kneel there in the sand, helpless and desperate and burning with jealousy I refuse to name.

"Don'tâ€”don't let himâ€”Elara, you don't have toâ€”"

"Oh HO!" Snib spins toward me, his reaching hand falling away from Elara's chest. His eyes gleam with delight. "THERE'S the HERO SPIRIT! Getting all PROTECTIVE, are we?"

"Pleaseâ€”"

"Gettin' all PURE and OUTRAGED." He waddles toward me, his tented loincloth bobbing with each step. "Like YE ain't done WORSE."

"What?" Elara's voice is strange. Distant. "What does he mean, 'worse'?"

Snib's grin shows every broken tooth.]I kneel there.

Silent. Trembling. Watching as Snib's warty hand rises toward my wife's breast.

*Let it happen. Let her make her choice. Don't interfere, don'tâ€”*

"Yer wifey's bein' GENEROUS, hero-cunt. Real UNDERSTANDIN'. A bit like YOU, eh? Not like that night at the INN."

The world stops.

"What?" Elara's voice is strange. Distant. "What inn?"

Snib cackles.

"Oh, she didn't TELL ye?" He looks between usâ€”me on my knees, Elara standing frozen, the collar humming against my throat. "About our SPECIAL TIME in Eboncrest?"

"Elise?" Elara's voice cracks. "What is he talking about?"

The collar *loosens*.

"Go on, titcow." Snib's voice is silk and broken glass. "Tell yer wife what ye did. Orâ€”" His grin widens. "â€”I can tell her MESELF. Got a REAL good memory fer details, I do."

passages.name: 04 truth choice
passages.label: Truth Choice
passages.text:
"I had toâ€”" My voice breaks. I can't look at her. Can't see whatever's happening on her face. "He told me to. The collarâ€”I couldn't refuse a direct command, and heâ€”"

"WHAT." Elara's voice is barely a whisper. "What did he make you do."

"He made meâ€”" I swallow. "He made me touch him. With my hand. Just once. Justâ€”"

"She JERKED me off, missus!" Snib crows, unable to contain himself. "Everyone knew it too! Them soft little fingers wrapped around me COCKâ€”" He grabs himself through his loincloth, demonstrating. "â€”pumpin' away like a good little SLUT!"

"That's notâ€”it wasn'tâ€”"

"Oh, it WAS!" Snib is practically dancing now, his arousal evident, his delight *obscene*. "Ye should've HEARD her, missus! Little gasps and moans every time I THROBBED in her hand! And when I NUTTED-" He makes an explosion gesture. "â€”she got some on her ARM and ye know what she did?"

I close my eyes.

"She LICKED it off! Wellâ€”wiped it, anyway. But she was THINKIN' about lickin' it. I could TELL."

"Is this true?" Elara's voice is so quiet I almost don't hear it.

"I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. I should have told you, I justâ€”I couldn'tâ€”"]My throat closes around the words like the collar itself has seized control of my voice, and all I can do is kneel there, silent, as Snib's grin spreads wider and wider.

"See, missus, while YE was back home cryin' into yer PILLOW, yer precious wifey and me was gettin' ACQUAINTED. In the back room of the, uh, the Silvery Stud. Real PRIVATE-like."

"Stop." My voice is a rasp. The collar *tightens*.

"She got down on her KNEESâ€”" Snib ignores me completely. "â€”just like she is NOW, actually. And she wrapped them soft little hands around me COCKâ€”"

He grabs himself through his loincloth. The fabric strains forward, the outline of his shaft grotesquely visible.

"All this GOBBO MEAT, and she stroked it like a whore. Up and down, up and down, them big titties BOUNCIN' with every strokeâ€”"

"STOP!" Elara screams.

"â€”and when I CAME, missus? When I finally BLEW?" Snib's eyes roll back in theatrical ecstasy. "So MUCH she couldn't catch it all!"

"Is this TRUE?" Elara's voice cuts through his gloating like a blade.

All I can do is nod.

Elara's face goes through something I can't watch.

"You touched him." Her voice is hollow.

"I had no choiceâ€”"

"There's ALWAYS a choice!"

She's crying now. Tears streaming down her freckled cheeks, her hands balled into fists at her sides.

"I came out here to PROTECT you! And you were alreadyâ€”you'd alreadyâ€”"

"Oh, it gets BETTER, missus!" Snib is *bouncing* now, practically vibrating with glee. He waddles over to where I kneel and grabs my ass with both handsâ€”*SQUEEZES*. "Should've seen her in the hut before ye showed up! Touchin' HERSELF on the straw pile! Fingers all up in her CUNT, moanin' and gaspin'â€”"

"STOP!" I scream. The collarâ€”

*Doesn't tighten.*

It feels *pleased*.

"â€”thinkin' about GOBBO COCK while she jilled off! I WATCHED, missus! Watched yer precious HUBBY frig herself silly not TEN FEET from where I was sleepin'!"

Elara looks at me.

The look in her eyes is worse than anything Snib has ever done.[Choice: 'Elara, pleaseâ€”'

passages.name: 04 aftermath
passages.label: Aftermath
passages.text:
"Elara, pleaseâ€”"

"Don't." She holds up a hand. Her voice is ice. "Justâ€”don't."

"Well THEN!" He claps his warty hands together. "Glad we got that all SORTED! Clears the AIR, don't it? No more SECRETS between wives!"

Elara doesn't respond. She's staring at me like she's never seen me before.

"Tell ye what." Snib's voice drops, almost *reasonable*. "Titcowâ€”" He snaps his fingers at me. "â€”ye can go walk the BOUNDARY-WARDS. Check the marker-stones. Make sure no nasty beasties are encroaching on ME domain. Been seein' Sandwalker-sign recently. Take yer TIME."

"I'm not leaving her alone withâ€”"

"Ye'll do what I TELL ye." The collar *clamps*. "Or we can have ANOTHER conversation about what happens when females get MOUTHY in Snib's territory."

I look at Elara.[Choice: She won't meet your eyes.

passages.name: 04 perimeter
passages.label: Perimeter
passages.text:
The collar snuggles against my throat, satisfied, as if it *enjoys* my misery.

*She knows. She knows EVERYTHING now.*

My heart pounds against my ribs.

*I should have told her. Should have told her BEFOREâ€”*

Jarkrond stands in the lean-to, watching me with those amber eyes. His nostrils flare as I passâ€”drinking in my scent, my *despair*â€”and something in his posture shifts.

I keep walking.

The perimeter is larger than I realized. Snib's territory extends past the hut, past the well, out to a ring of marker stones half-buried in sand. The collar seems to *tug* when I try to cut the circuit short, forcing me to trace the full boundary as my master commanded.

*What is he doing to her right now?*

The thought is acid in my veins. I try not to imagine it.

When I've walked for a while, the metal at my neck seems to relax.

The hut is visible from here. Just visibleâ€”a dark shape against the bright sand, smoke still curling from the chimney hole.

The hide-flap is closed.

passages.name: 04 watch choice
passages.label: Watch Choice
passages.text:
I shouldn't.

I *shouldn't*.

I leave the perimeter path and creep toward the back of the hut. Thereâ€”a gap between the mud-bricks and slats, where the mortar has crumbled away. Just wide enough to see through if I press my eye close.

*Don't look. Don'tâ€”*

I look.

The interior is dim, lit only by the cookfire's glow. Elara stands near the central post, her arms crossed over her chest, her jaw set in that fierce way I know so well.

Snib circles her like a shark circling wounded prey.

"â€”don't have to be DIFFICULT about it, missus." His voice carries through the wall, muffled but clear. "Just a little FEEL. Ye want to keep yer wifey SAFE, don't ye?"

"I agreed to ONE touch." Elara's voice is ice. "You've had THREE."

"Them was just WARM-UPS!" Snib cackles.

Then his hand rises.

I watchâ€”*gods help me, I WATCH*â€”as his warty green fingers cup my wife's breast through her blouse.

Her eyes close.

Her jaw tightens.

[Image: She doesn't pull away.

But she doesn't pull away.

"See?" Snib's voice drops to something almost tender. "That ain't so bad, is it? Real SOFT." He *kneads* the flesh through the fabric, his fingers sinking into the modest swell of her. "Not like yer wifey's big floppy UDDERS. These got... ELEGANCE."

"You're *scum*." Elara's voice shakes.

"But yer still LETTIN' me, ain't ye?" His other hand rises. Now he's cupping *both* breasts, pressing them together through her blouse, his face level with her chest. "Standin' there all PROUD while Snib gets his FEEL."

"Because you'll hurt her if I don't."

"Never said anything 'bout hurtin' anyone," His thumbs find her nipples. They're stiffeningâ€”*gods*â€”hardening beneath the thin fabric despite her disgust. "When will ye stop PRETENDIN' ye don't like it?"

Elara's eyes snap open.

"I will NEVERâ€”"

"Yer body says DIFFERENT, missus." Snib pinches both nipples simultaneously. Elara gaspsâ€”a small sound, involuntary, *horrifying*. "Feel that? Ye've sniffed enough gobbo. It gets in yer HEAD. Makes everything feel... *nice*."

He releases her.

Elara sags against the post, her breath coming in short gasps, her face flushed with shame.

"That was payment," Snib waddles toward his fur pile. "For all the trouble ye caused with the mare. Really upset Jarko-boy."

I pull back from the gap.

My hands are shaking. My whole body is shaking. Between my thighs, something *clenches*â€”

*No. NO.*]I keep walking.

The collar seems almost *disappointed* as I trace the full perimeter, checking each marker stone, scanning the horizon for threats that don't exist.

*What is he doing to her?*

The thought loops endlessly. I picture his hands on her body. His mouth near her ear, whispering filth. His *cock*, that massive thing, pressing against her through his loincloth while she stands there.

I find the snare line.

Three of the five traps are empty. One holds a sand-hare, still warm. The last has caught something largerâ€”a thornback lizard, its spines bristling even in death.

Good. At least we'll eat well tonight.

I reset the empty snares with hands that won't stop trembling. Tie the catches to my belt. Try not to think about what's happening in the hut, what I'm *letting* happen by being out here instead of in there.

*She's doing this for you. She's trading pieces of herself so you can survive.*

The thought makes me want to vomit.

When I finally return, the hide-flap is open.

Elara doesn't look up when I enter.

The rest of the day passes in silence.

She cooks. I clean. We move around each other like strangers sharing a room at an inn, careful never to touch, never to meet eyes. The things we don't say fill the hut like smoke.[Choice: Evening comes.

passages.name: 04 evening silence
passages.label: Evening Silence
passages.text:
"Same rules." Snib yawns from his fur pile. "NAKED. Both of ye."

We undress without speaking.

)I try not to look at Elara's breasts as she removes her blouse. Try not to see the faint red marks where Snib's fingers pressed too hard. Try not to remember watchingâ€”*choosing* to watchâ€”as he touched what was mine.

She catches me looking anyway, and she blushes.]I try not to look at Elara as she removes her blouse. Try not to see if there are marks. Try not to imagine what happened while I was checking snares like a *coward*, like someone who'd rather not know than face the truth.

Her expression is stone.

The straw crackles as we settle onto the pile.

Back to back.

"I understand." Her voice comes out of the darkness, barely audible. "Why you did it. The collarâ€”you had no choice."

Relief floods through me. "Elaraâ€”"

"But I need time." She shifts slightly. The straw rustles. "To... process. Everything. Everything you didn't tell me. I'm... not used to it."

"I should haveâ€”"

"Yes." The word is flat. Final. "You should have."

Silence stretches between us.

"I still love you," she says quietly. "That hasn't changed. But right now I'm... angry. And hurt. And I need to feel those things before I can feel anything else."

Snib's snores fill the darkness. Somewhere outside, Jarkrond stamps in his lean-to. The wind whispers across the sand.

I lie awake for hours, staring at the mud-brick wall, feeling the warmth of my wife's back inches from mine and knowing I can't reach for her.[Choice: The next day...

passages.name: 04 day5
passages.label: Day5
passages.text:
I wake to the smell of cookingâ€”grains bubbling in water, the sharp green scent of herbs I recognize. Elara has found some desert berries and combined them with oats and wild honey from her travel supplies.

"Morning," I try.

"Breakfast is almost ready." She's polite, but it sounds like the voice she uses with strangers.

Snib waddles in from outside, scratching his balls with one hand.

"MORNIN', ladies!" His yellow eyes sweep over usâ€”Elara at the cookfire, me standing awkwardly by the straw pile. His grin spreads like oil on water. "How'd we SLEEP? Nice and COZY, were we?"

Neither of us answers.

"Aw, still SORE about last night?" He cackles and throws himself onto the bench by the makeshift table. "Come on, then! Let's eat!"

Elara serves him first.[Choice: Watch her serve him.

passages.name: 04 breakfast serve
passages.label: Breakfast Serve
passages.text:
Then she serves herself. A smaller portion.

Then, she pushes a bowl toward me. Smallest of all.

I sit across from them at the hobbled construct that is our "dining" table. It's narrow. Snib's knees nearly touch mine beneath the planks.

"This is GOOD, missus!" He shovels porridge into his mouth with his bare hands, honey dripping down his chin. "Real WIFELY. Ain't it nice, titcow? Havin' a proper COOK around?"

I don't answer. My eyes are on Elara's handsâ€”the way they grip her spoon.

"Ye know," Snib continues, chewing wetly, "I been thinkin'. About our little ARRANGEMENT. Gave hero-cunt here some DEALS, didn't I? Be a good girl, take gold off the debt. Very REASONABLE."

Elara's jaw tightens.

"Maybeâ€”" Snib's grin widens. "â€”maybe the MISSUS would like the same opportunity? Ye want to get OUT of here faster, don'tcha? Get back to yer fancy COTTAGE?"

"What kind of deals?" Her voice is carefully neutral.

"Oh, THIS and THAT." Snib waves his spoon airily. "Could knock a HUNDRED off right now, if ye wanted. Just gotta sit in me LAP while we finish breakfast."

Elara's hands still on her bowl.

passages.name: 04 breakfast choice
passages.label: Breakfast Choice
passages.text:
"Elara, don'tâ€”"

Her head snaps toward me. Those sapphire eyes blaze with something I can't quite name.

"Don't WHAT, exactly?" Each word lands like a slap. "Don't make DEALS with him? Don't TOUCH him? Don't do exactly what YOU'VE been doing since before I even GOT here?"

"That's differentâ€”"

She laughsâ€”a harsh sound, nothing like her real laugh. "The only DIFFERENCE is that I'd be *honest* about it!"

Snib cackles with delight. "Ooh, there's the FIRE again! I love it!"]I say nothing. What CAN I say? She's right. I did it first.

Elara studies my silence. Something shifts behind her eyesâ€”disappointment, maybe. Or resignation.

And sits.

On his lap.

Her back is straight. Her jaw is set. She stares at the far wall as Snib's arms wrap around her waist, his stubby fingers settling on her thighs through her breeches.

"THERE we go." His chin rests against her shoulder blade. I can imagine what's going on beneath her, that massive shaft pressing up against the curve of her ass. "See, titcow? YER WIFE knows how to be FRIENDLY."

My hands clench beneath the table.

"See? Easy money! Maybe ye should LEARN from her." Snib's fingers knead Elara's thigh, slow and possessive. "Instead of gettin' all JEALOUS and POUTY."

"I'm notâ€”"

"I can SMELL it on ye." His yellow eyes fix on mine over Elara's shoulder.

The collar *pulses*. Almost *amused*.

Elara reaches for her bowl. Continues eating. As if the goblin beneath her doesn't exist.

"The herbs are from home." Her voice is quiet. Directed at me.

"I thought... you might like the taste."

passages.name: 04 herb response
passages.label: Herb Response
passages.text:
"Thank you."

The words come out rough. Barely audible.

Elara's expression softens slightly. The ghost of the smile she used to give me when I'd bring her flowers from the market, or when I'd fall asleep at my desk and she'd drape a blanket over my shoulders.

"You're welcome."

Snib scowls. "Oi! Less MUSHY, more EATIN'!"]The porridge hurts because it tastes of the memory of mornings in our kitchen before any of this.

But the silence stretches between us like a wound, and when I finally look up, Elara has turned away."Are you okay?"

Elara stiffens. Her spoon pauses halfway to her mouth.

"I'm FINE." The words are clipped. Final. "Eat your food."

Snib cackles. "Told ye she was LEARNIN'! Ain't got time for yer WORRY, hero-cunt. The missus knows what's what now."

Snib shifts beneath Elara, his hands sliding from her thighs to her hips.

"Ye can go do yer TRAP-CHECKIN' and HUNTIN' now, bounce-bags." His voice is thick. "Me and the missus got DOMESTIC matters to discuss. Ye best bring us back some nice food, so ye can get a bigger portion!"

Elara doesn't look at me as I rise.

"But ye best check on Jarko-boy first... he's takin' it all pretty rough."

My wife doesn't look at me as I walk toward the hut entrance.

Doesn't look at me at all.[Choice: Check on Jarkrond.

passages.name: 04 jarkrond grief
passages.label: Jarkrond Grief
passages.text:
It's strange - Jarkrond's body language has totally changed. He almost looks... pitiful. Like I feel.

The space where Clover stood is empty.

He keeps looking at it.

I pause at the entrance, suddenly uncertain. This isn't the aggressive stallion who dropped his cock at the sight of me, who tracked my movements with hungry intelligence. This is... something else.

He makes a sound.

Low. Mournful. It sounds almost like *keening*.

*He's grieving.*

Ash-runners are intelligentâ€”everyone knows that. But seeing it, *feeling* it in the way the lean-to seems to pulse with his sorrow...

*He actually loved her. Or something.*

I move slowly. Carefully. I should still keep my distance.

But he doesn't react. Doesn't lift his head. Doesn't even seem to notice I'm here.

His amber eyes drift to mine. Tired. The predatory sharpness is still there, buried deep, but it's drowning in despair.[Choice: We're... the same.

passages.name: 04 jarkrond grief2
passages.label: Jarkrond Grief2
passages.text:
*We're the same*, I think suddenly. *Both of us watching something we love slip away.*

Jarkrond's tail swishes once. Twice. A fly buzzes near his ear and he doesn't flick it away.[Choice: 'I'm sorry.'

passages.name: 04 jarkrond grief3
passages.label: Jarkrond Grief3
passages.text:
"I'm sorry." Stupidâ€”he's a *horse*, he can't understandâ€” right?

Or... can he?

His head lifts, just slightly. His nostrils flare, drawing in my scent, and something shifts in his expression.

I think about Elara, sitting on Snib's lap. Her back straight, her jaw set, her eyes fixed on nothing while his hands roamed her body. The way she didn't look at me. The way she *chose* not to look at me.

"She's still in there," I say quietly. "They're still... they just need time. Elara needs time, and she'll be alright."

The strange thing isâ€”he *feels* like he's listening. Hearing the isolation beneath them. The fear.

"She's been breathing his scent for days now." My voice cracks. "Goblin pheromones. They get into your head, make you... want things. Things you shouldn't."

Jarkrond's ear swivels toward me.

"I don't know if I can get her back." The admission tears something open in my chest. "I don't know if there will be anything LEFT to get back by the time we're free."

He shifts his weight. One massive hoof scrapes the earthâ€”a sound like grinding stone.

And then he moves toward me.

My heart stutters. But his approach is slow. Deliberate. Slow. Ponderous. A mountain deciding to walk.

He stops beside the hay bale where I'm perched. His barrel chest is level with my shoulder. The heat radiating off his grey hide is immediate, envelopingâ€”like standing too close to a forge.

Is he... comforting me? No. That's ridiculous. He may be more intelligent than the average horse, but not THAT intelligent.

I let out a breath I didn't know I was holding.

His muzzle slides lower. Past my shoulder. Down my arm.

"Thank you," I whisper. "I can tell you miss Clover."

The heat of him is making my head swim. The air thickens with him. *Earthy*. Sun-warmed leather, copper, the green-salt of living things.

It coats the back of my throat with each breath. Settles into my brain like smoke.

It smells *natural...* like the horses I've been around my whole life. But then again, Aldric never got *lightheaded* from the smell of horses. Never felt hisâ€”*her*â€”thoughts go soft at the edges, like ink bleeding into water.

Jarkrond's muzzle is at my hip now. Still moving. Still *searching*.

"Easy, boy." My voice comes out strange. "Easy."

His nostrils flare against my thigh.

And then he *inhales*.

The sound is *obscene*. A deep, wet SNUFF that seems to pull the air from my lungs along with whatever scent he's seeking. His barrel chest expands, his whole massive body *drinking* me in.

*He's smellingâ€”*

No.

*No.*

Through the wool of my breeches. He's pressing his velvety muzzle against the junction of my legs and *breathing me in* like I'm the most intoxicating thing he's ever encountered. The heat of his breath soaks through fabric that suddenly feels far too thin.

The fog parts around one clear, cold thought:

*He has pheromones too.*

Not like Snib's. Different. Deeper. Something that bypasses my brain entirely and speaks directly to the animal that lives in my hindbrainâ€”the creature that knows, on some instinctive level, that this is a *dominant male* investigating a *potential mate*.

My thighs are shaking.

passages.name: 04 jarkrond response2

The sand becomes mud. The mud becomes mire.

And the smell changes.

First comes vegetationâ€”*green* things, after two days of nothing but dust and Snib's rotting musk. My lungs drink it in like wine. Then the rot arrives beneath it, sweet-sick and cloying, the perfume of things decomposing underwater where the sun can't find them. Jarkrond's ears pin flat against his skull.

"I know," I tell him, because suddenly I do. The Sandwalkers who left that fox skull on Snib's doorstep didn't come from the Shifting Sands at all. I'd assumed desert tribeâ€”the *Kheth-Suul*â€”but these tracks lead into swampland.

The *Kheth-Muur* - they're Marsh-Walkers.

Aldric fought alongside them once, years ago, against a band of river pirates who'd been raiding both human and Sandwalker settlements near Lowmarsh. He remembered their bone-crested hair. Their milk-white scars. The way they moved through water like ghosts made of leather and obsidian.

He also remembered their Bone-Seers.

The trees begin around the same time the ground loses any pretense of solidity. They're not trees anymore, not reallyâ€”they're *corpses* of trees, drowned oaks and willows that died standing and never fell. Their bark has rotted away to reveal wood bleached bone-white by decades of submersion, and from every skeletal branch hangs the bone-moss.

Grey and fibrous, trailing in curtains from the canopy, it sways in air that never quite becomes wind. When one strand brushes my shoulder, I flinchâ€”it's *rough*, like dried sinew.

And the soundâ€”

The desert was *silent*. A held breath. A vacuum.

Birds call from somewhere in the bone-white canopyâ€”strange sounds that might be warnings or might be lures. *Nine moons later...*

The sun births itself from the eastern rim of the world, and I watch it paint the Shifting Sands the color of old blood. My bare feetâ€”somehow still soft as any noblewoman's despite months of walking on reed-mat and boneâ€”find the boundary where black marsh-mud gives way to golden dust. Behind us, the Muraat-Kheth drowns in its own rot. Before us, the desert yawns like the mouth of a god we have not yet learned to worship.

The baby kicks when I watch the sunrise. She always does â€” restless at dawn, like her father.

The collar at my throat has been silent for three moons. Just cold metal, dead as the warriors I butchered on that platform. Sometimes I touch it and wait for Snib's voice, that familiar pulse of command. Nothing comes. He has forgotten me, or found what he truly wanted in the cottage where I left my wife.

*Elara.* The name sits in my chest like a stone. I wonder if she still breathes. I wonder if goblin musk has rewritten her as thoroughly as Kareth-Suul's seed has rewritten me.

Sapphire blue. Wet with tears. *Fierce* with love.

"I've got you," she whispers. "I've got you, my love. Rest now."

The desert is quiet.]I let the bow lie.

passages.name: 04 journey back
passages.label: Journey Back
passages.text:
[Image: The desert forgives nothing, but at dusk it pretends to.

The fragrance rides me even nowâ€”honeyed and skin-hot and *ruinously* feminineâ€”drowning the horse-sweat and the blood and the cum-reek in something so beautiful it makes me want to claw my own throat open.

passages.name: 04 gobboree

passages.text:
Thousands of goblins crammed into a desert oasis produce a pheromone cloud visible as a SHIMMER above the dunesâ€”a heat-haze of concentrated breeding-musk that makes both of us gasp and grip Jarkrond's mane tighter. "Steady," Elara murmurs. To me. To herself.

Tents. HUNDREDS of tents. Hide and red canvas and stolen sail-cloth spreading across the oasis in concentric rings around a central fire-pit the size of a city temple. Drums already POUNDINGâ€”a heartbeat. Goblin voices raised in the guttural, wet music of Goblishâ€”arguing, laughing, the particular shriek-cackle of males comparing cock-sizes.

Some nursing green-skinned pups at their breasts. One womanâ€”blonde, northern, her belly enormous with what must be quadrupletsâ€”catches my eye and *smiles*. The smile of someone who has passed through horror into something beyond it.

I smile back.

Snib leads us through the crowd. One warty hand on each of our asses. Three feet eight inches of exile walking back into his people with a "wife" at each side.

"Is thatâ€”"

"Can't beâ€”"

"SKULGAROTH?"

"NAH!"

Snib's chin lifts. His walk develops a *strut* I've never seenâ€”this bandy-legged, pot-bellied SWAGGER that makes his loincloth swing and his balls pendulum beneath it.

"*THEM'S ME WIVES!*" he screams at nobody and everybody. "*GRAK THRACKTA BOOYAGH WIVES!*"

The registration goblinâ€”ancient, one-eyed, his remaining eye milky with cataractsâ€”squints at us across his bone-table. Squeezes my left tit with clinical detachment. Inspects Elara's belly with a calloused palm. Both of us respond with the appropriate Goblishâ€”"*Gruk-thrak, Elder. Grak grip-slit belong Snib-thrackta*"â€”and his one eye goes WIDE.

"They speak PROPER?"

"BOTH of 'em," Snib says. Vibrating.

The elder stamps his hide-scroll. Looks at Snib with an expression freighted with centuries of goblin social architecture.

"Welcome back, exile. Your wives do you honor."

Snib makes a sound I've never heard from him. Not a cackle. Not a hruk. A small, cracked noise from somewhere in his warty chest where goblins apparently keep whatever they use instead of hearts.

We each squeeze a hand.

The dance circle forms at moonrise.

Hundreds of goblins stamping in concentric rings around the central fire, which has been fed until it roars fifteen feet high, throwing sparks into a sky salted with more stars than I've seen since childhood. The heat is ferocious. The noise is DEAFENING. Other slaves have performedâ€”shuffling, reluctant, pheromone-drunk things that earned polite grunts.

"PRESENTING!" The elder's voice, impossibly loud. "SNIB OF WORMTOOTH! AND HIS TWO THRACKTA!"

The roar that answers shakes sand from the dune-crests.

We step into the circle.

Burgundy and green. Silk catching firelight. Golden chains. Bone-beads. Bare feet pressing into sand still warm from the day's heat. Both bellies swelling with green life under gossamer fabric.

The drums SHIFT. Someone has started a breeding-chant rhythm. Four-four time. The bass hits my breastbone like a second heart.

*BOOM-BOOM-CLAP.*
*BOOM-BOOM-CLAP.*

Elara moves first. Her hips catch the beat and ROLLâ€”compact, precise, the green silk flowing around her belly like water around a stone. Her copper braids swing. The bone-beads CLICK counterpoint.

I answer. My body has learned to be ITSELF in the months since transformationâ€”not fighting the curves but WIELDING them. My hips describe arcs that make the burgundy silk billow. My tits sway in their halter with a momentum that five hundred yellow eyes track like cats tracking a bird. The waist-chains sing.

Our bellies brushâ€”her full moon against my rising crescentâ€”and the contact sends the babies tumbling inside us, responding to each other through the walls of silk and skin and womb. Our silk BILLOWS in the firelit updraft, burgundy and green tangling and separating, and the crowd begins to CHANT:

We break apart. Back to back. The CLAP beginsâ€”my massive cheeks providing the thunder through silk that does nothing to muffle the sound, Elara's adding the snap.

*BOOM-BOOM-CLAP-PAP.*
*BOOM-BOOM-CLAP-PAP.*

Five hundred goblins STOMPING along. The sand LEAPS. The fire SURGES.

We face each other again. Close. Our foreheads almost touching. The sweat on our skin catching firelight like we've been dipped in honey. And Elara begins to sing.

Her voiceâ€”that clear soprano that used to fill the Eboncrest chapel during Flux's Danceâ€”rises above the drums. But the words are NOT Common tongue. They're Goblish. Broken, beautiful, *obscene* Goblish that we practiced in whispers while Snib wept with pride:

*"Grunt-grunt, splurt-splurt,*

My voice joins hers. The harmony we found during sennights of morning prayer, repurposed for thisâ€”a hymn to the god of breeding, sung by two pregnant human women in silk and firelight:

Our foreheads touch. Green eyes meeting sapphire. The fire warm on our backs. The silk warm on our bellies. The collar warm on my throatâ€”no, not warm. *Silent*. I can't feel it at all.

And then: new drums. Softer. A rhythm for dancing, not competing. Just *music*â€”the first real music since everything changed.

Elara pulls me onto the sand.

Just *us*. Spinning slowly in a circle of firelight, silk flowing, chains chiming, our bellies pressed together with the roundness of what we're becoming. Her hand on my waist. Mine on hers. Our cheeks touching. Her copper hair mixing with my black.

Around us: a sea of green. Yellow eyes and broken teeth and the reek of pheromones and fermented bark-milk and the drumbeat of a species that is fucking itself to extinction while dragging ours along for the ride.

Above us: stars. The same stars that shone over Eboncrest when Aldric carried Elara across their threshold. The same stars that don't care.

Snib watches from his throne of goblin shoulders. Bone-crown askew. Tears drying in the creases of his warty face. Three feet eight inches of the most unlikely king in Zaelasia, and he looksâ€”for the first time in his miserable, exiled lifeâ€”like he belongs somewhere.

"The news travels faster than caravans." I keep my voice steady. Keep my eyes on his. Don't look at the crossbows. Don't think about where Snib's thumb is. "If this creature knows what happened in those minesâ€”what the goblins FOUND down thereâ€”"

"Then Fendril should hear it." The younger guard, surprisingly. He's looking at me differently now. His eyes keep dropping to my chest, to the way the breast-band frames everything, to the collar at my throat.

*"Told ye the tits would work,"* Snib breathes against my spine.

"We'll escort you to Fendril's tower." Harwick gestures to the younger guard. "Fetch rope."

"Rope?" My voice doesn't crack. Doesn't.

"For the goblin." Harwick's eyes are granite. "Standard procedure. We're not walking that thing through Eboncrest unbound."

Behind me, Snib's fingers DIG into my hip. His whisper goes urgent: *"Don't let 'em touch me, bounce-bags. Collar don't likeâ€”"*

But I KNOW the collar's rules. Better than he does, apparently.

Binding isn't violence. Binding is restraint.

The collar would allow this.

"Nothing?" Harwick's blade rises an inch. "Woman rides into Eboncrest on an ash-runnerâ€”GOBLIN mountâ€”with a goblin pressed against her back, claiming business with our wizard, and she knows NOTHING about our missing hero?"

"I've been traveling. The Shifting Sands don't carry much news."

"But you know about the raids increasing. Know about the mines." The younger guard is circling now. Jarkrond's ears flatten. "Know enough to claim this creature has VALUE."

*Shit. Shit. SHIT.*

"Desert travel. The heatâ€”"

"The HEAT." He almost laughs. "You expect me to believeâ€”"

"I believe," the younger guard interrupts, "we should let Fendril sort this out."

Harwick turns. The younger man shrugs.

"Keep her under guard. If something's wrongâ€”" his hand rests on his sword, "â€”Fendril will know. And if she's lying about any of this..."

He doesn't need to finish.

Harwick's jaw works. Then: "Rope. For the goblin."

Behind me, Snib's grip tightens. *"Don't let 'emâ€”"*]The words leave my mouth before I can stop them.

Harwick goes STILL.

"Dead." His voice is quiet. Too quiet. "And how would YOU know that?"

*THRACK.*

"Iâ€”the minesâ€”goblins have beenâ€”"

"What DID you mean?" The younger guard has his hand on his sword. "How do you KNOW what happened in those mines?"

Snib's fingers dig into my hip. For once, he's silent. Even HE can feel the temperature change.

"I heard rumors. At Thistlecross. Traders sayingâ€”"

"Traders saying WHAT?" Harwick steps closer. "That Aldric the Great fell to goblins? That the hero of Eboncrest is DEAD?" His eyes find the collar at my throat. The breast-band. The creature pressed against my spine. "Or did your little friend there TELL you what happened?"

Harwick studies me for a long moment.

Behind me, Snib's grip goes painfully tight.

*"Don't let 'emâ€”"*"Binding ritual." Harwick doesn't sound convinced. "And this ritual requires you to dress like a dockside whore while the creature GROPES you in public?"

Heat crawls up my neck. Snib's hand is still on my breast, and swatting him away would only make things worse.

Behind me, Snib's whisper goes urgent: *"Don't let 'em touch me, bounce-bagsâ€”"*"Mayor Bramble." Harwick's laugh is ugly. "You're threatening me with BRAMBLE? While riding a goblin horse, dressed like a pleasure-slave, with a green bastard's hand on your tit?"

The younger guard snickers.

"I know my rightsâ€”"

"Your RIGHTS?" Harwick steps closer. Jarkrond snorts but holds position. "You have no rights in Eboncrest until I say you do. And right now, all I see is a suspicious woman who knows too much about our missing hero, claims ownership of a GOBLIN, and threatens guards with political consequences."

*"Yer really thrakkin' this up,"* Snib breathes against my neck. His cock is somehow HARDER now. *"Should've let ME talk."*

*"Don't letâ€”"*

passages.name: 04 guard binding
passages.label: Guard Binding
passages.text:
The words taste like surrender. But surrender keeps us alive.

"Do what you must."

Snib's fingers SPASM against my hip. His hiss is pure venom: *"Ye BITCHâ€”"*

But the collar doesn't tighten - must sense the necessity.

The younger guard approaches with rope. Coarse hemp, the kind used for livestock. His eyes keep finding my chest as he circles behind us.

"Hands," he orders Snib.

For a moment, I think the little bastard will refuse. Will say something that gets us both killed. His cock is still pressed against my ass, still HARD somehow, and his breathing has gone ragged with fury.

Then: "FINE. Tie 'em up, boy-o." Snib extends his warty arms. "Just rememberâ€”" his yellow eyes find mine over my shoulder, "â€”she ASKED fer this."

The guard binds him roughly. Good.

"Off the horse," Harwick commands. "Both of you."

First, I have to swing my leg over Jarkrond's neckâ€”the scale-breeches CLING to my inner thighs, riding up, metal plates clicking together in a way that draws every eye. Then the DROP.

*CLOP.*

My heeled boots hit cobblestone. The impact shoots up through my calves, my knees, makes my tits BOUNCE inside the breast-band with a meaty SLAP that echoes off the gatehouse walls.

I stagger. Catch myself on Jarkrond's flank.

"Flux's teeth." The younger guard is staring. "What kind of boots are THOSE?"

"Desert wear," I manage. "The elevationâ€”"

"Keeps her arse lookin' PROPER," Snib cackles as the guards haul him down. His bound hands don't stop him from leering. "Lookit 'er WALK in 'em. Like a mare in season!"

The guards exchange glances. My soul crawls under a rock and pulls the dirt over itself.

"The horse stays outside," Harwick says. "We're not bringing that thing through the market."

Jarkrond's ears flatten. His orange-amber eyes find mine with unsettling intelligence.

"He's tame. Just a horse."

"That's no horse." Harwick's hand rests on his sword. "Ash-runners don't TAME."

Jarkrond snorts. Stamps. His barrel chest rumbles with something that sounds almost like... SPEECH. Low vibrations that make my teeth ache.

"Jarko's fine," Snib offers, too cheerfully. "He'll wait. Won't ye, boy?" The bound goblin makes a clicking sound with his tongue.

The ash-runner's ears swivel. Then, with eerie deliberation, he backs toward the open ground beyond the gate. Settles onto his haunches. WAITS.

Like a trained dog.

Like a partner.

"Flux preserve us," the younger guard mutters.

Harwick's jaw tightens. "Move. Both of you. And if that goblin so much as BREATHES wrongâ€”"

"He won't." I meet his eyes. "I need him alive. Fendril needs him alive. Whatever happened in those minesâ€”he's the only one who might know."

The lie sits heavy on my tongue.

But it gets us moving.[Choice: The march through Eboncrest begins.]"Docile." Harwick tastes the word. "A GOBLIN."

"He understands the situation." I keep my voice level, half aiming it at Snib. I hate that this little green stain is controlling my very life right now. "He knows what happens if he causes trouble."

Behind me, Snib goes very, very still. Thenâ€”

"Oh AYE." His voice drips with mockery. "I'm DOCILE as a lamb, me." His bound-free hands slide up my ribs, cup both breasts from behind, squeeze them UPWARD until the breast-band nearly fails. "See? GENTLE. Wouldn't hurt a fly."

The guards' hands fly to weapons.

"Unlessâ€”" Snib's hands begin to wander, "â€”the fly WANTED hurtin'. Then maybeâ€”"

"ENOUGH." I grab his wrists performatively. Pull them down. My face is burning. "He's making a point. Poorly."

"Point being?" Harwick hasn't drawn, but his knuckles are white on the hilt.

"Point BEIN'," Snib cackles, "ye could gut me any time ye liked. Big strong guards with big sharp swords. What's one little gobbo gonna do?" He spreads his arms wideâ€”displaying his small frame, his complete vulnerability. "DOSE ISLE."

The logic is twisted. But it's not WRONG.

Harwick's eyes narrow. Then: "Fine. No ropes." His blade clears the sheath with a whisper of steel. "But this stays OUT. And if you so much asâ€”"

"Yeah, yeah. Gut me like a fish." Snib waves a dismissive hand. "Can we GO now? Getting' bored of this foreplay."

The guards exchange looks. The younger one mouths 'foreplay?' with visible confusion.

"Off the horse," Harwick growls. "NOW."

The scale-breeches catch on Jarkrond's rough hide as I swing my leg over. Metal plates CLICK together. The breast-band shifts, threatening to spill. And then the DROPâ€”

*CLOP.*

High heels meet cobblestone. The impact reverberates through my entire bodyâ€”calves screaming, tits BOUNCING, ass JIGGLING inside too-tight scale-mail.

"Eon's balls." The younger guard isn't even pretending not to stare. "What ARE those?"

"Desert boots," I manage through gritted teeth. "The elevationâ€”"

"Keeps her cunt away from the sand-crawlers," Snib finishes helpfully, dropping down beside me with a grunt. "Also makes her arse look FANTASTIC. Watch when she walks."

The guards haul him away before I can respond.

"The horse stays," Harwick orders. "We're notâ€”"

"He'll wait." Snib makes a clicking sound. Jarkrond's ears swivel, and the ash-runner backs away with unsettling intelligence, settling outside the gate like a trained hound. "Good boy, Jarko."

"Flux preserve us," someone mutters.

Harwick's blade stays drawn. "Move. And I'll be watching that goblin's hands the ENTIRE way."

"Oh, she LIKES when people watch," Snib cackles.

They march us forward. Every eye on the street is a branding iron.[Choice: The march through Eboncrest begins.]"No! You can'tâ€”"

The words escape before I can stop them. Panic. Raw, animal PANIC at the thought of them touching himâ€”of the collar somehowâ€”ofâ€”

Harwick's expression changes.

Suspicion.

"She's protecting it." His voice goes flat. Cold. "Look at the collar. Look how she FLINCHES when we threaten the creature."

"Noâ€”you don't understandâ€”"

"Enchanted." The younger guard's hand moves to his crossbow. "Seen it before. Goblin mind-magic. They get in your head, make you WANT toâ€”"

"I'M NOT ENCHANTEDâ€”"

"That's what they all say." Harwick's blade rises. "Kill it. Save the woman."

"WAITâ€”"

*THWACK.*

The crossbow bolt takes Snib in the chest before I can scream.

His grip on my hip goes slack. His eyesâ€”yellow, gleaming, SURPRISEDâ€”find mine for one frozen moment.

*THWACK.*

A second bolt. His body jerks. Slides sideways off Jarkrond's haunches.

[Image: Cold iron BITING into my throat. Crushing.

And the collarâ€”

â€”TIGHTENSâ€”

Cold iron BITING into my throat. Crushing. The ancient metal knows its master is dying and it's completing the bond, finishing what was always promisedâ€”

"THE COLLAR!" Someone's shouting. "It's KILLING her!"

Hands grab me. Pull me from the horse. I'm clawing at my throat, can't breathe, can't THINKâ€”

"Get a blacksmith! NOW!"

But there's no clasp. No seam. Just metal that won't stop CONSTRICTINGâ€”

The world goes grey at the edges. I see Snib's body on the cobblestones. See blood pooling. See Harwick's horrified face as he realizes what's happening.

"We killed it! Why isn't sheâ€”"

Because the collar doesn't CARE about intentions. Doesn't care that they were trying to SAVE me. Master dies. Slave dies.

That was always the rule.

The last thing I see: Eboncrest's walls, golden in morning light.

The last thing I hear: guards shouting for help that won't come in time.

The last thing I feel: the collar completing its purpose.

And somewhere, in the fading dark, I almost hear it LAUGHING.

passages.name: 04 march fendril
passages.label: March Fendril
passages.text:
*CLOP. Click. CLOP. Click.*

My heel-boots mark a rhythm I never asked for. Each step a controlled fall forward.

Harwick walks ahead. The younger guardâ€”I still don't know his nameâ€”walks behind. And Snib...

Snib walks beside me. Close enough that his shoulder brushes my hip. Close enough that his hands can find my ass when the guards aren't looking.

*Squeeze.*

I don't react. Can't react. Not with Harwick glancing back every few steps, suspicion carved into his weathered face.

"The tower's not far," the younger guard offers. Almost... apologetic? His eyes keep finding my chest. "Master Fendril should be in. He's always in."

*"Master Fendril,"* Snib mimics under his breath. *"Ooh, a WIZARD. Bet he's got a big pointy hat and everything."*

"Shut UP," I hiss.

"What was that?" Harwick turns.

"Nothing. He's... muttering."

"Goblins do that." Harwick's lip curls. "Right before they try something."

"He won't try anything." I glare down at Snib. At the creature who OWNS me, walking beside me like a child being escorted to punishment. "Will you?"

Snib's yellow eyes gleam. "Wouldn't DREAM of it, milady." He sketches a mocking bow that nearly trips him. "I'm just a humble gobbo, after all. Here to help. To COOPERATE."

"See that you do," Harwick growls.

We pass the market square.

*CLOP. Click. CLOP. Click.*

People are staring. Of COURSE they're staring. A woman dressed like THIS, walking with guards, a GOBLIN at her sideâ€”

"Flux's mercy, is thatâ€”"

"â€”never seen a goblin inside the wallsâ€”"

"â€”look at her OUTFITâ€”"

"â€”probably a pleasure-slave, you know how theyâ€”"

I keep my eyes forward. Keep walking. Keep pretending I can't hear Mrs. Fletcher's gasp, can't see how the baker's apprentice nearly drops his tray, can't feel the weight of a hundred gazes on my breasts, my ass, the collar at my throat.

*"Popular, ain't ye?"* Snib's whisper is gleeful. *"Bet they're wonderin' what ye TASTE like."*

"Eyes front," Harwick snaps at the growing crowd. "Nothing to see here. Town business."

"Town business with a GOBLIN?" Someone shouts. "After what happened to Aldric?"

I stumble. Catch myself on nothing.

"That's ENOUGH." Harwick's hand goes to his sword. "Anyone interfering with guard business answers to Captain Giles. MOVE ALONG."

The crowd parts. Reluctantly. But their eyes follow us all the way to the wizard's tower.

Fendril's tower rises at the north end of townâ€”limestone and ambition, five stories of spiral windows and weather-worn gargoyles. The highest point in Eboncrest. I've climbed those stairs a hundred times. Drunk tea in that cluttered study. Laughed at the old man's terrible jokes about transmutation.

Now I'm climbing them as a stranger. As a suspect. As a woman with impossible tits and a goblin at her heels.

"Wait here," Harwick tells the younger guard at the tower's base. Then, to us: "Up. Both of you. And rememberâ€”" his blade stays drawn, "â€”I'm RIGHT behind you."

The spiral stairs are agony in heels.

Each step forces my weight onto the balls of my feet. My calves SCREAM. My thighs tremble. And the narrow spiral means my ass is directly at Harwick's eye levelâ€”scale-breeches clinging to every curve, cheeks FLEXING with each upward push.

"Quite a view," Snib observes loudly.

"QUIET."

"Just sayin'. If I was behind her, I'd beâ€”"

"I said QUIET."

Snib subsides. But I can FEEL his grin against the back of my thigh where he's pressed close on the narrow stairs.

Four flights. Four flights of burning muscles and bouncing flesh and Harwick's eyes boring into my ass. By the time we reach Fendril's door, I'm sweating through the breast-band.

Harwick pounds on ancient oak.

"Master Fendril! Guard business! Open up!"

Shuffling from within. The click of locks. And thenâ€”

The door swings open.

Master Fendril looks exactly as I remember. Silver hair like a bird's nest. Spectacles so thick they magnify his eyes to owl-like proportions. That same patchwork robe he's worn since before I was born.

"Harwick? What's all this noise about? I was in the middle of a very delicateâ€”" His gaze falls on me. Travels down. Stops on Snib.

His owl-eyes go WIDE.

"Flux's infinite branches." The words come out strangled. "Is that... is that a GOBLIN?"
