"Woman claims she's got business with you," Harwick says. "Magical research. Something about the Ironrock situation."

"I... I see." Fendril hasn't stopped staring at Snib. At the collar. At the way my body strains against inadequate armor. "Perhaps... perhaps you'd better come in."

The study is exactly as I remember. Books stacked to the ceiling. Artifacts on every surface. That peculiar smell of sulfur and failed experiments.

And now: me. Standing where Aldric once stood. In a body that would make Aldric weep.

"Leave us," Fendril tells Harwick.

"Sir, I don't thinkâ€”"

"I have wards on this room that would stop a rampaging troll." The wizard's voice is firm despite his shaking hands. "If anything goes wrong, you'll know. But whatever this isâ€”" his eyes find mine, searching, "â€”it requires privacy."

Harwick hesitates. Then: "I'll be right outside. ANY troubleâ€”"

"Yes, yes. Thank you, Harwick."

The door closes.

The lock clicks.

And I'm alone with Master Fendril and the goblin who owns my soul.

Snib's grin spreads like rot. "Well, well, well. A REAL wizard." He hops onto Fendril's reading chair, muddy feet swinging. "This oughta be GOOD."

Fendril hasn't stopped staring at me. At the collar. His spectacles flash as he leans closer.

"That metalwork," he breathes. "Those inscriptions. I've seen drawings of such things, but I never thoughtâ€”" His eyes meet mine. Really MEET them. "Who ARE you?"

The question I've been dreading.

The question I have to answer.

Because if anyone in Eboncrest might understand, might HELP, it's the town wizard.[Choice: 'Master Fendril... it's me. It's Aldric.'

passages.name: 04 fendril reveal
passages.label: Fendril Reveal
passages.text:
Silence.

Fendril's gray eyes don't widen. Don't narrow. They simply... *settle*. Like a hawk finding its perch.

"HRUK!" Snib cackles from the reading chair, his muddy feet swinging. "There it is! The big reveal! Ye should see yer FACE, wizard-man!"

Fendril's attention is fixed on me with an intensity that pins me to the floor. Those thick spectacles catch the light from a dozen floating candles as he steps closer.

"You claim you are Aldric," he says quietly. "The hero who went to clear Ironrock. Three days ago."

"Yes." The word comes out strangled. "I found a chamber beneath the mines. Pre-human stonework. And thisâ€”" My hand flies to the collar. Cold metal against my fingertips. "â€”this THING was there. It... changed me. Bound me to him."

I jerk my head toward Snib, who's now examining a preserved lizard in a jar with the expression of a child at a sweetshop.

"Changed you." Fendril's voice is carefully neutral. Analytical. A scholar examining a curious specimen. "Changed how, exactly?"

"EVERYTHING." The hysteria rises before I can stop it. "My body. My voice. Myâ€”" I gesture helplessly at the obscene curves barely contained by the breast-band. "â€”EVERYTHING. But my mind is stillâ€” I'm still ME. I'm still Aldric. I remember you teaching me the wind-calling when I was twenty-three and nearly blew myself off the tower roofâ€”"

"You DID blow yourself off the roof." A ghost of a smile touches Fendril's lips. "I caught you. Barely."

"You saidâ€”" My voice breaks. Tears are coming. These THRAKKING tears that come so easily now. "â€”you said 'Aldric, you have the magical subtlety of a drunk ox.'"

Fendril goes very still.

"Touching," Snib drawls. "Real touching. Can we GET ON WITH IT? I didn't drag me property across the desert to watch ye two reminisce."

"Property." Fendril's voice doesn't change, but something in his posture does. "You claim ownership of this... person?"

"Don't CLAIM nothin'." Snib hops off the chair, waddling over to stand beside me. His hand finds my hip with casual possessiveness. "Collar says she's mine. Collar don't LIE." He grins up at the wizard, showing all those broken teeth. "Smart thing, the collar. TALKS to me. Tells me all sortsa things about me new pet here."

Fendril's eyes sharpen almost imperceptibly. "The collar... communicates with you?"

"That's what I SAID, ain't it?" Snib scratches his balls through his loincloth. "Told me her real name. Told me she was a hero. Told me how to BREAK her." His grip tightens on my hip. "Made me CLEVER, it did."

I watch Fendril process this. His expression remains mild, academic, but I've known him long enough to recognize the intensity beneath.

"Remarkable." Fendril adjusts his spectacles. "Truly remarkable. The artifact appears to have formed some manner of... symbiotic link with you."

"Don't know what SYM-BEE-OTTIC means, but sure." Snib waves a dismissive hand. "Point is, SHE'S mine. And ye'r gonna help me get what's OWED me."

"Owed?"

"Ten thousand gold." Snib's yellow eyes gleam. "Hero-cunt here's got it in the bank. Savings from all that monster-killin'. Once I get me gold, I'll let her go. Simple as."

Fendril's gaze meets mine. There's a question there.

"The collar has conditions," I manage. My throat is tight. "If... if I perform such a task to satisfy my m-masterâ€”" The word tastes like ash. "â€”he'll release me. That's what he's told me. He has assured me... he will keep his word."

"Heartwarmin'," Snib snorts. "Nowâ€”ye gonna help or not? 'Cause if not, me and me cow-tits here are gonna take a walk through yer lovely town. Maybe visit the market. Maybe visit the WIFE." His grin sharpens. "Bet she'd LOVE to hear what happened to her husband."

The threat hangs in the air.

Fendril's face remains placid, but I see his jaw tighten almost imperceptibly.

"Before we discuss... logistics," he says smoothly, "I'd like to verify what I'm being asked to believe. You understand, I hope. A claim of this magnitude requires evidence."

"Evidence?" Snib scowls. "She just TOLD yeâ€”"

"Memories can be extracted. Implanted. Stolen." Fendril moves toward a cluttered workbench, pushing aside star charts and alembics. "If this truly is Aldric the Great, there are ways to confirm it that don't rely on narrative recollection."

He returns with a sheet of parchmentâ€”thick, cream-colored, marked with faint silver runesâ€”and a pot of ink.

"Give me your hand."

Snib's fingers dig into my hip.

"Do what the wizard says, pet. It'll help me get me gold."

I extend my hand.

Fendril takes it gently. His hands are warm, dry, steady. He turns my palm upward and begins painting it with the ink in precise strokes.

"The soul leaves markers on the flesh," he explains, his voice taking on the lecturing tone I remember from years of late-night discussions. "Impossible to falsify."

"Sounds like horseshit," Snib mutters.

"Many things that sound like horseshit turn out to be true." Fendril doesn't look up from his work. "And many things that sound true turn out to be horseshit. That's rather the point of verification."

He presses my ink-covered palm to the parchment. Holds it there for three heartbeats. When he lifts it awayâ€”

Light blooms across the page. Silver runes IGNITE, dancing in patterns that make my eyes water. The ink from my palm spreads, shifts, WRITES ITSELF in letters that glow like trapped starlight.

And above the handprint, in script that no mortal penned:

**ALDRIC THE GREAT**
*Hero of Eboncrest*
*Bound in Service to the Collar-Bearer*

The last line pulses with a sickly green undertone.

"Well." Fendril's voice is very quiet. "That's that."

I stare at my name. MY name. Written in light and magic, proof that I still exist somewhere inside this prison of flesh.

"HARHARHAR!" Snib's laugh shatters the moment. "Lookit her CRY! The great hero, blubberin' like a babe! That's ADORABLE, that is!"

Fendril sets the parchment aside. When he turns back to us, the scholar is gone from his face. What's left is older, and angrier.

"The collar," he says carefully. "May I examine it? I won't touchâ€”merely observe."

Snib's hand shoots to my shoulder, yanking me back. "No funny business, wizard. Ye try anything, ANYTHING, and I tell the collar to squeeze. She'll be dead before ye can say 'zooky.'"

"I understand." Fendril raises his hands, palms out. "No funny business. I'm simply... curious. This is clearly a piece of considerable antiquity."

He leans close. I can smell pipe tobacco and old books. His gray eyes trace the collar's inscriptions, the way the metal seems to move beneath its surface, the runes that writhe like disturbed snakes.

"The metallurgy alone..." he breathes. "And these inscriptions. I've seen drawings, but never..." He trails off, visibly restraining himself. "This will require study. Considerable study."

"Study all ye want," Snib says. "AFTER I get me gold."

Fendril straightens. His expression becomes businesslike.

"The bank won't release funds without the account holder's presence and consent. Aldricâ€”" He glances at me. "â€”is the account holder. But Aldric, legally speaking, appears to be missing. Possibly dead."

"She AIN'T dead. She's right HERE."

"To you and me, yes. To the bank's officials?" Fendril spreads his hands. "They'll see a strange woman and a goblin. You will need my assistance."

"Then we MAKE 'em seeâ€”"

"There may be another way." Fendril moves toward his desk, rifling through papers. "The identity parchment. If I present this to the bank alongside theâ€”the ladyâ€”it should satisfy their requirements. Magical verification is accepted in matters of disputed inheritance and identity fraud. This would qualify."

"Ye can DO that?" Snib sounds suspicious. "Just... tell 'em she's Aldric?"

"I can present evidence that she IS Aldric. Whether they accept it is another matter. But my word carries weight in this town." A dry smile. "One of the few benefits of being the local wizard."

Snib's eyes narrow. He's calculating. I can almost SEE the collar feeding him informationâ€”probabilities, risks, optimal strategies.

"Fine," he says finally. "But firstâ€”" His grip on my hip tightens. "â€”I wanna see the wife. This is gonna be DEE-LIGHTFUL!"

My heart stops.

"That's... not wise," Fendril says carefully. "The emotional strainâ€”"

"Wasn't ASKIN' yer opinion." Snib's voice goes flat. Dangerous. "The wife. NOW. Or I start screamin' in the market square about what really happened to Eboncrest's precious hero. See how the townfolk like THAT news."

The threat hangs there, doing its work.

Fendril's expression doesn't change, but I see his shoulders stiffen slightly. He's weighing options.

"Very well," he says finally. "But first, we need to address the guards outside. They'll need to be informed of... the situation. They would typically not allow a... goblin to be walking freely through Eboncrest, there will be violence."

"Then TELL 'em." Snib waves impatiently. "Ye're the wizard. Make 'em understand."

Fendril nods slowly. His eyes find mineâ€”a brief connection, weighted with meaning I can't quite parse.

"Wait here," he says. "Both of you. I'll speak with Harwick."

He moves toward the door. Pauses. Turns back.

"Aldric." The name is soft. Deliberate. "Whatever happens next... I want you to know that I'm going to find answers. About the collar."

"Careful, wizard." Snib's voice is a razor wrapped in silk. "Collar's LISTENIN'. Always listenin'. Ye try to take what's mine, and she pays the price."

Fendril's smile doesn't reach his eyes.

"I wouldn't dream of it."

The door closes behind him.

I'm alone with Snib.

His hand slides from my hip to my ass. Squeezes.

"Nice wizard," he says. "Shame if somethin' happened to him."

passages.name: 04 fendril guards
passages.label: Fendril Guards
passages.text:
I stand where Fendril left me, trying to breathe, trying not to think about what comes next.

*Elara.*

The name is a wound that won't stop bleeding.

Three days. She's been alone for three days. Mourning me. Probably barely eating. I know how she gets when she's worriedâ€”pacing the floors, checking the window every few minutes, burning dinner because her mind is elsewhere.

And now she's going to see THIS.

"Quit yer mopin'." Snib's found a small mirror and is examining his teeth in it. "Makin' me depressed just LOOKIN' at ye."

I don't answer.

"Here's how it's gonna work, cow-tits." He sets down the mirror, turns to face me fully. "Ye get me the gold. All ten thousand. Then ye escort me OUT of this thrakkin' townâ€”SAFELY. No tricks, no guards followin', no arrows in me back."

"And then you'll release me."

"THENâ€”" He holds up a warty finger. "â€”I ride off into the sunset. One day later, the collar lets ye go. Gives me time to get CLEAR, see? Can't have ye chasin' me down the moment yer free."

One day. One more day as his property, even after he has what he wants.

"You said when you got the gold. Not a day AFTER."

"What I SAID was I'd let ye go when I got me gold." His grin shows all those broken teeth. "Never said HOW I'd let ye go. Ye think I'm stupid? The SECOND that collar comes off, ye'll be reachin' for a sword. Nah. I need me head start."

My hands clench at my sides.

"Now," he continues, waddling closer. "Before them humies come back in and we gotta play nice..." His yellow eyes travel up my body. "Bend over."

"What?"

"Ye heard me. BEND. OVER." His voice goes hard. "All this talkin' to humans, all this 'Master Fendril' and 'Aldric the Great' shiteâ€”ye're forgettin' who ye BELONG to. Need remindin'."

The collar hums against my windpipe. A dog's choke-chain at rest."Master." The word still sticks in my throat, but I force it out. "Master, please. Before we see Elaraâ€”before you threaten herâ€”can we just... talk? About what you actually WANT?"

Snib pauses his examination of a pickled something-or-other. Turns. His yellow eyes narrow with what looked like curiosity.

"What I WANT?" He scratches his chin. "What I want is to be RICH, cow-tits. Rich enough to never grovel to no tribe-chief again. Rich enough to have me own warren, me own females, me ownâ€”"

"Then let's focus on that." I keep my voice steady. Reasonable. "The gold. Ten thousand. I can get it for you. Fendril will help. But Elaraâ€”my wifeâ€”she doesn't need to be part of this. She can't give you anything you don't already have access to through me."

He studies me for a long moment.

"Yer scared," he says finally. "Scared I'll hurt her."

"Yes."

"Good." His grin spreads slowly. "Fear keeps ye HONEST." He waddles closer. "But here's the thing, bounce-bags. I AIN'T gonna hurt yer precious wifey. Not unless ye give me reason. What I WANT is to see her FACE when she sees what her big strong hero's become. That's worth more than gold."

My stomach turns.

"And ye're gonna be on yer BEST behavior," he continues. "Gonna call me Master in front of her. In front of EVERYONE. That's an ORDER. I'm sick of ye treatin' me like some monster ye found under a rock. I'm yer OWNER. Time ye started actin' like it."

"Yes, Master."

"Better." He nods, satisfied. "Nowâ€”here's how it works after. Ye get me the gold. Ye escort me outta town SAFELY. Then I ride off, and one day later, the collar lets ye go. Gives me time to get clear."

"One day? You saidâ€”"

"I said I'd let ye go. Never said WHEN exactly." His eyes glitter. "Ye think I'm stupid? Second that collar comes off, ye'll have a blade in yer hand. Nah. I need me head start. One day. Then yer free."

One more day. Even after everything.

"Now." He waddles closer still. "Before them guards come back... bend over."

"What?"

"All this talkin'. All this negotiatin'. Ye're gettin' IDEAS, I can tell." His voice hardens. "Need remindin' who's in charge. Bend over."

My heart hammers.

"Pleaseâ€”"

"Do it or I put ye back in yer OLD outfit. Or maybe NOTHIN' at all." His hand finds his loincloth, adjusting the bulge beneath. "Walk ye through the market bare-arsed. See how yer townsfolk like THAT view."[Choice: Bend over.

passages.name: 04 bend over
passages.label: Bend Over
passages.text:
[Image: My hands find my knees.

"That's better." I hear him move behind me. "Now. Who do ye belong to?"

"You, Master."

"LOUDER."

"You, MASTER."

*CRACK.*

His palm connects with my ass like a thunderclap. The scale-breeches do nothing to absorb the impactâ€”the metal just TRANSFERS it, sends it rippling through flesh that won't stop JIGGLING.

"Again. Who OWNS this fat arse?"

"You do, Master!"

*CRACK.*

The second blow lands harder. I gaspâ€”can't help itâ€”the sound high and feminine and PATHETIC.

"And who's gonna be a GOOD GIRL in front of the guards? In front of yer WIFE?"

"I am, Master!"

*CRACK. CRACK. CRACK.*

Each impact sends shockwaves through my body. My tits bounce against the breast-band. My eyes water. The SOUND echoes off Fendril's stone walls, off his books and artifacts, off centuries of accumulated knowledge that does nothing to help me now.

The door opens.

"We've spoken with the mayâ€”"

Harwick stops mid-sentence.

I'm still bent over. Snib's hand is still raised. The tableau freezes like a painting of damnation.

"Ah." Fendril's voice comes from behind the guards. Carefully neutral. "I see we've... interrupted."

I straighten slowly. Face burning. Eyes on the floor.

The two guardsâ€”Harwick and the younger oneâ€”stare at me with pity so thick it could choke a man.

They KNOW. They know I'm Aldric. They've seen the parchment, heard Fendril's explanation. And now they've seen their hero bent over, getting spanked like a disobedient tavern wench.

"Right then!" Snib claps his hands together cheerfully. "We all sorted? Can we GO now?"

Harwick's jaw works. His hand hasn't left his sword.

"Master Fendril has explained the... situation." The words come out like he's chewing nails. "We understand that any harm to you results in harm toâ€”" His eyes flick to me. Away. "â€”to Aldric."

"Damn RIGHT it does." Snib raises his hand.

The air TWISTS.

Black metal manifests from nothingâ€”coiling out of the collar itself like a snake unspooling from its den. It spirals downward, link by impossible link, until the end lands in Snib's waiting palm with a soft *clink*.

My leash. Conjured from the collar's own dark substance.

Fendril says nothing. But I see his eyes ignite behind those spectaclesâ€”the feverish gleam of a scholar watching the laws of nature snap in half. His fingers twitch toward his notebook before he catches himself.

"See THIS?" Snib holds up the leash, letting it catch the candlelightâ€”or rather, letting it DRINK the candlelight, the metal somehow darker than shadow. "This ain't just jewelry, boys. This is OWNERSHIP. Watch."

He yanks.

The collar RESPONDS. The metal TIGHTENs around my neck and GUIDES me, forcing my body to move in ways I don't choose. My knees buckle. I drop.

*THUD.*

"Good GIRL." Snib pats my head like I'm a dog. His fingers tangle in my hairâ€”this silk-soft hair that used to be warrior-short. "See how EASY she comes to heel?"

"This isâ€”" Harwick starts.

"She's MINE." Snib's voice goes cold. He tugs the leash again, forcing my chin up. I'm staring directly at the bulge in his loincloth, inches from my face. "Tell 'em, pet. Tell 'em who ye belong to."

My throat works. The words taste like poison.

"I belong to Master Snib."

"LOUDER. So the nice guards can hear."

"I belong to Master Snib!"

"And what are ye?"

The collar PULSES. I feel it feeding him the words it wants me to say.

"I'm... I'm his property."

"HRUK-HRUK-HRUK!" Snib's laugh echoes off the stone walls. "There we go! See, boys? Perfectly TRAINED." He releases my hair, lets me sag forward. "Now. We done with the demonstrations? Or ye want me to show ye what ELSE she can do on her knees?"

Harwick's face has gone the color of old parchment. The younger guard looks like he might vomit.

"That won't be necessary," Fendril says quietly. His voice is steady, but I can see the calculation behind his eyes. The theories forming. The horror carefully contained. "I believe we all understand the... nature of the binding."

"Good." Snib tugs the leash, and I riseâ€”unsteadily, these thrakking heels threatening to betray me. "Then let's GO. Me and me pet have a wifey to visit."

He doesn't release the leash.

Doesn't even shorten it.

Just holds it loosely, letting it trail between us like an umbilical cord of damnation, as he waddles toward the door.

"Master, pleaseâ€”" I start.

"Did I ASK?" He yanks. I stumble forward, tits bouncing, ass jiggling, the guards parting to let us pass. "Ye wanted to talk to humans. Fine. We talked. Now we're goin' to see yer WIFE, and ye're gonna do it PROPERLY." He turns to the guards. "Ye can follow if ye want. Keep yer distance though. This is FAMILY business."

"The mayor has agreed to... accommodate... your requests," Fendril says quietly. "For the time being. But understandâ€”this town loved Aldric. If you harm herâ€”himâ€”"

"Yeah, yeah. Pitchforks and torches." Snib waves dismissively. "Save yer threats, wizard. I just want me gold and me freedom. Keep yer peasants off me back, and nobody gets hurt."

He tugs the leash again.

"Come on, titcow. Time to go home."[Choice: The longest walk of your life begins.
choices: The longest walk of your life begins.

passages.name: 04 walk home
passages.label: Walk Home
passages.text:
*CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK.*

My heels ring against cobblestones I've walked a thousand times.

The leash pulls taut with each step, the leather collar-attachment digging into my throat, forcing me to keep pace with Snib's waddling stride.

Behind usâ€”twenty paces back, as orderedâ€”Harwick and the younger guard follow. Their eyes are on me. The leash. My ass SWAYING in these thrakking scale-breeches with every mincing step.

They know it's me.

They KNOW.

"Mornin'!" Snib calls out to a passing merchant. "Lovely day, innit?"

The merchantâ€”old Henrik's boy, the one who lost fingers to the wyvernâ€”stares. His cart full of turnips sits forgotten. His mouth opens. Closes. Opens again.

"That's... that's a goblin."

"And THIS is me pet." Snib tugs the leash, making me stumble closer. "Ain't she pretty?"

Henrik's boy looks at me. At my barely-contained tits, my collared throat, the leash in a goblin's hand. His face settles on horror. But his eyes linger a half-second too long on my chest.

"Move along," Harwick growls from behind us. "Town business. Nothing to see."

We move.

Past the fountain where children played this morningâ€”they're gone now, mothers having dragged them inside at the sight of us.

*CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK.*

Finally, we turn onto Temple Street.

And there it is.

Our house. Mine and Elara's. Nestled next to the smithy, just as it's always been. The roses in the window boxâ€”she must have watered them, even through her grief. The boots by the doorâ€”MY boots, Aldric's boots, still waiting for feet that may never fill them again.

The smoke from the chimney.

She's home.

My heart stops.

"Well, well." Snib's voice is thick with satisfaction. "This is gonna be GOOD."[Choice: Approach the door.

passages.name: 04 elara door
passages.label: Elara Door
passages.text:
The door opens before I can knock.

Her hairâ€”that autumn fire I've buried my face in a thousand timesâ€”is half-undone, strands escaping a hasty braid. Dark circles bruise the skin beneath her sapphire eyes. She's been crying. Recently. The tracks still glisten on her cheeks.

She looks like a woman attending her own husband's funeral.

And then she sees us.

"Can I helpâ€”"

Her voice dies.

Her eyes find me first. Travel down. The black metal straining against my huge tits. The scale-breeches clinging to hips wider than any woman in Eboncrest. The collar at my throat.

The LEASH.

Her gaze follows the black cordâ€”follows it from my neck, down, down, to the warty green hand holding its other end.

To Snib.

She makes a strangled gasp, like someone drowning on dry land. Her hand flies to her mouth.

"Whatâ€”WHOâ€”" She's looking at me now, really LOOKING, and I can see her trying to make sense of what she's seeing. A goblin. A leash. A woman dressed like a pleasure-slave. On HER doorstep. "Get AWAY from my houseâ€”"

"Elara."

Her name breaks from my throat before I can stop it. Wet. Desperate. Nothing like Aldric's baritone.

She freezes.

"How do you know myâ€”" Her eyes narrow. Then widen. Something flickering behind themâ€”recognition trying to surface through layers of impossibility. "How do you know my NAME?"

"HRUK-HRUK!" Snib yanks the leash, pulling me forward. I stumble, tits bouncing, and he GRINS up at her. "Mornin', missus!"

"I'll SCREAM." Elara's voice has gone hard. Dangerous. I know that voice. "I'll scream and every guard in Eboncrest willâ€”"

"They're already HERE, luv." Snib jerks his thumb backward. Harwick and the younger guard stand at the garden gate, faces carefully blank. "Go on. Ask 'em why they ain't killin' me. Ask 'em who THIS is." He tugs my leash again. "Go on, cow-tits. Introduce yerself to the missus."

Elara looks to Harwick. He gives the smallest nod.

When she looks back at me, the blood leaves her face like wine poured from a glass.

"No." The word is a whisper.

"Elara." I'm crying now. I can't stop it. These tears that come so easily, streaming down cheeks too soft, too feminine. "Elara, it's ME. I know you can'tâ€”I know this doesn't make SENSEâ€”but it's me. It's Aldric."

"Don't you DARE." Her voice cracks. "Don't you DARE say his name. My husband is DEAD. He went to those mines and he NEVER CAME BACK and youâ€”you're notâ€”you CAN'T beâ€”"

"Elara, it's ME." The tears come. "I know this doesn't make sense. But it's me. It's Aldric. Ask me ANYTHING. Something only we would know."

Her jaw tightens. Testing me. Looking for the lie.

"Prove it."

passages.name: 04 prove elara
passages.label: Prove Elara
passages.text:
"The Festival of Lights." The words tumble out, wet and desperate. "We snuck into the market square at midnight with the lanterns we'd painted for weeks. You wore this dressâ€”THIS dress, Elaraâ€”and you climbed on my shoulders to reach the high hooks. A cat startled us. We nearly fell. You laughed so hard you couldn't breathe and I had to cover your mouth so we wouldn't wake the watchman."

"The paint wasn't dry. Remember? You had blue handprints on your thighs for three days because Iâ€”" My voice cracks. "â€”because I grabbed you when we stumbled. You told everyone it was from helping the dyers.""Old Briar's Bridge." I'm crying now. Can't stop. "The rainstorm that came out of nowhere. You were shivering so hard your teeth chattered. I gave you my coat and we pressed against the oak tree and that's when Iâ€”" My voice breaks. "â€”that's when I told you I loved you. First time. You said 'finally' and punched my arm."

Her breath catches.

"We carved our initials that night. E and A. You made me add a heart because you said I was 'emotionally stunted' and needed practice. It's still there. The scar in the bark. I check it every time I cross that bridge.""Your grandfather's ring." The memory surfaces through my tears. "The Summer Solstice Fair. You thought you'd lost itâ€”tore apart every stall, every patch of grass. You were crying. I'd never seen you cry before."

"It was in your herb pouch. You'd taken it off to apply salve to that little boy's scraped knee. And later, by the fire, you put it on my finger." I hold up my handâ€”these small, feminine fingersâ€”and imagine the weight of it. "You asked if I'd always be your knight. Even when I turned into an old, grumpy man."

Her lip trembles.

"I said forever and always."

She stares at me.

At my eyes.

The same moss-green that Aldric had. The only thing unchanged.

"Aldric?"

The word is barely a whisper.

And then she's CRASHING into me.

Her arms wrap around my neckâ€”pulling me down because I'm SHORTER nowâ€”and she's sobbing into my shoulder, her whole body shaking.The embrace is desperate, bone-deep, shaking.

"I thought you were DEADâ€”" Her voice is muffled against my neck. "â€”three days, I couldn't eat, I couldn't SLEEP, I kept waiting for someone to bring me your BODYâ€”"

"I'm here." I'm crying too. These tears that come so easily now. "I'm alive, Elara, I'mâ€”"

[Image: I'm crying too.

"I prayed to every god. I begged Flux for change, begged Verge for a different future, begged Eon to let me keep just one more MEMORY of youâ€”"

"I'm sorry. I'm so sorryâ€”"

She pulls back. Cups my face in her hands. Studies me with red-rimmed eyes.

"You're so..." Her thumb traces my cheekbone. My jaw. The softness where hard angles used to be. "You're so DIFFERENT. But your eyesâ€”I can see you in there. I can SEE youâ€”"

"I'm still me. Inside. I'm stillâ€”"

"TOUCHIN'!"

Snib's voice shatters the moment like a thrown stone.

His yellow eyes are drinking in every sob, every desperate clutch, every broken whisper.

"Real touchin'." He tugs the leash, just enough to remind us it's there. "Sweet little reunion. Makes me heart grow three sizes, it does."

Elara's head snaps toward him. Her arms tighten around me.

"You." Her voice has changed. Gone from grief to something colder. "You did this to him."

"Weren't ME, missus. It was the collar." Snib grins, adjusting his balls. "But yer husband makes a FINE little housemaid. Should see how she scrubs me floors. On her hands and knees, them big udders danglin' and swayin'..."

"Stop."

"...sweatin' through that little metal outfit I keep her in. The SMELL of her when she's been workin' all dayâ€”like flowers growin' in a whorehouseâ€”"

"I said STOP."

"And at NIGHT." Snib's grin spreads wider. "Ohhh, at night. When them urges get too strong for her new body. When she's lyin' in the hay, fingers between her legs, moanin' like a bitch in heatâ€”"

"SHUT YOUR MOUTHâ€”"

"â€”thinkin' about YOU, probably. Or maybe thinkin' about ME. Hard to tell with all that squealin' and gushin'. Either wayâ€”" He yanks the leash HARD, pulling me away from Elara's embrace. "â€”she's MINE now. Every fat tit, every bouncy arse-cheek, every wet little hole. MINE."

Elara's face has gone white.

Then red.

Her eyes find the kitchen. The knife block.

passages.name: 04 stop elara
passages.label: Stop Elara
passages.text:
I see it happen like a painting.

The knife catches the afternoon sunâ€”that good butcher's blade, the one she uses for Sunday roastsâ€”and it GLEAMS with righteous fury. Elara's autumn hair flies behind her like a war banner. Her face is twisted with grief and rage and our years of love turned to VENGEANCE.

She's beautiful.

She's TERRIFYING.

And I don't stop her.

Some part of meâ€”the part that's still Aldric, still the warrior who killed a hundred goblins, still the man who HATES this creature with every fiber of his beingâ€”that part WANTS this. Wants to see that blade sink into green flesh. Wants to hear him SCREAM.

*Do it. DO IT. End this nightmareâ€”*

The blade finds its mark.

Snib's eyes go wide. His mouth opensâ€”to curse, to threaten, to laughâ€”but only blood comes out.

"That's for my HUSBAND," Elara snarls, and TWISTS.

Snib crumples.

And the collarâ€”

â€”WAKES.

Cold iron BITES into my throat. CRUSHINGâ€”instant and absolute, instant and absolute, ancient magic completing its oldest promise.

*Master dies. Slave dies.*

I try to scream but there's no air. Try to claw at the metal but my fingers find no purchase. The world goes grey at the edges, then black, thenâ€”

"ALDRIC!" Elara's voice, distant, drowning. "ALDRIC, NOâ€”"

She's beside me. Hands on the collar. Pulling. SCREAMING for help.

But there's nothing to pull. No clasp. No seam. Just metal that won't stop CONSTRICTINGâ€”

The guards are shouting. Someone's running for a blacksmith. Elara is sobbing my name over and over, her hands red with goblin blood, her eyes wild with a new horrorâ€”

She killed the monster.

And killed me too.

The last thing I see: her face. Beautiful. Broken. Understanding too late what she's done.

The last thing I feel: the collar finishing what it started.

The last thing I hear: my wife screaming as the light goes out.

*I love you.*

*I'm sorry.*

*Iâ€”*

]Time slows.

I see it unfold in perfect clarityâ€”the way Elara's hand closes on the knife handle, the way her body PIVOTS, the way her arm draws back for the killing strike. The afternoon sun catches the blade. It gleams like a promise.

For one heartbeat, I let myself imagine it.

The steel punching through Snib's chest. The way his yellow eyes would go wide. The bloodâ€”dark, thick, SATISFYINGâ€”pooling on our kitchen floor. His grip on my leash going slack. His body crumpling. The nightmare ENDING.

It would be so BEAUTIFUL.

"ELARA, NO!"

My body moves before my mind catches up. These legs that aren't mine, these arms wrapped in soft flesh instead of muscleâ€”they LUNGE. I crash into her from the side, both of us going down in a tangle.

The knife skitters across the floor.

"LET ME GO!" She's FIGHTING meâ€”clawing, kicking, trying to get free. "LET ME KILL THAT FUCKINGâ€”"

"You CAN'T!" I'm pinning her down, my weightâ€”such as it isâ€”pressing her to the floorboards. "Elara, LISTEN to meâ€”"

"He TOOK you! He CHANGED you! He made you into his thrakking SLAVEâ€”"

"If he DIES, I die!" The words rip from my throat. "The collar! It's BONDED! If you kill him, Iâ€”"

She goes still.

Her sapphire eyes find mine. Wide. HORRIFIED.

"What?"

"The collar." I'm crying again. Can't help it. "It's linked to him. If anything happens to himâ€”if YOU hurt himâ€”I die too. That's why the guards won't act. That's why Fendril can't help. That's whyâ€”"

"HRUK-HRUK-HRUK!"

Snib's laughter cuts through the moment like a rusty blade.

He's standing by the mantelpiece, arms crossed, watching us wrestle on the floor. The knife lies between us and him, but he doesn't even look at it.

"Should've let her try, pet." He grins. "Would've been REAL dramatic."

"You MONSTER." Elara's voice shakes with fury. "You disgusting, vile, wretched little BEASTâ€”"

"Sticks and stones, missus." Snib examines his claws. "Nowâ€”yer done? Good." His eyes find mine. "Tell her."

My stomach drops.

"Tell her WHAT."

"Tell her who ye belong to." His voice goes hard. "Tell her what happens if she tries that shite again. And call me MASTER when ye do it."

The collar pulses against my throat.

I look at Elara. At my wife. At the woman I've loved for six years, now pinned beneath me, staring up at the creature her husband has become.

"Elara." My voice is barely a whisper. "Please. Don't... don't try to hurt him again."

"Aldricâ€”"

"He's my..." The word sticks. BURNS. "...he's my Master. The collar made it so. And if anything happens to himâ€”ANYTHINGâ€”I die."

Her face crumbles.

"Say it PROPER," Snib demands. "Tell her who OWNS ye."

The tears come faster.

"I belong to Master Snib." The words taste like grave dirt. "I'm his... his property. His slave. And you have to let himâ€”let him do whatever heâ€”"

"ENOUGH."

The door CRASHES open.

Harwick and the younger guard burst through, swords drawnâ€”then freeze at the tableau. Two women tangled on the floor. A goblin by the fireplace. A knife gleaming between them.

"What in Flux's nameâ€”"

"Bit of a hearth-squabble," Snib says cheerfully. "The missus got her hackles up. All sorted now though. Ain't it, pet?"

I can't speak. Can only nod.

Elara is staring at me with pity. Raw, marrow-deep pity. The kind that kills love.

"Get OFF me," she whispers.

I roll away. Stand unsteadily.

Elara rises slowly. Her green dress is rumpled. Her hair wild. Her eyes...

Her eyes move over my body.

Really SEEING it for the first time. Past the face, past my eyesâ€”to the REST. The breasts straining against black metal. The hips flaring beneath scale-mail. The legs, the waist, the ass that won't stop EXISTING no matter how much I hate it.

"You're..." Her voice breaks. "You're really... THIS now."

"Yes."

"And you can't... the collar can't be..."

"Not unless he releases me."

She looks at Snib. At his grin.

Then back at me.

"We need to get you proper clothes," she says. Her voice has gone strange. Hollow. "You can't walk around in... in THAT. And we need to... there has to be a way to..."

"The mayor's been informed," Harwick says quietly from the doorway. "The... situation."

Elara's head snaps toward him.

"The MAYOR knows?"

"Had to, ma'am. Can't have a goblin walking through Eboncrest withoutâ€”"

"So the whole TOWN is going to know." Her voice rises. "Everyone's going to know that Aldricâ€”that my HUSBANDâ€”is..." She gestures at me, at all of me, words failing. "...is THIS?"

"Not... yet."

But soon. Eboncrest gossips like crows over carrion.

Eboncrest's hero. The man who saved them a hundred times. Now a collared, leashed, tit-heavy slave to a three-foot goblin.

Elara's legs give out.

She crumples onto a kitchen chair, head in her hands, shoulders shaking.

I want to go to her. Want to hold her. But the leash keeps me at Snib's side, and the guards block any sudden movement, and all I can do is stand here in this OBSCENE body while my wife falls apart.

Finally, she looks up.

Her eyes find Snib. Red-rimmed. Ruined. But steady.

"What do you want." A surrender. "Just... tell me what you want. I'll do anything. ANYTHING. Just give me back my husband."

Snib's grin spreads slowly.

"Now we're talkin'."[Choice: Explain what Snib wants.]

passages.name: 04 explain snib
passages.label: Explain Snib
passages.text:
[Image: 'He wants... he wants ten thousand gold.'

"He wants... he wants ten thousand gold."

Elara flinches like she's been slapped.

"Ten THOUSAND?" She repeats it like she's testing whether the words are real. "Aldric, that's... that's almost EVERYTHING. That's our SAVINGS. That's what we were putting aside for..."

She doesn't finish.

*For the baby. For the future. For the life we were building together.*

"I know."

)"Course, she's already knocked a bit off," Snib says casually, examining his claws. "Been a GOOD girl, yer husband. Very... cooperative."

Elara's head snaps toward him. Then toward me.

"What does that MEAN?"

Heat crawls up my neck like a rash. I can't speak. Can't explain. Can't tell her about kneeling in the filth of his hut, about the words he made me say, about BEGGING him toâ€”

Elara stares at me. A light goes out behind her eyes.

"We should go to the bank," I whisper. "Please. Can we just... go?")"She's been REAL eager to work off her debt," Snib chuckles. "Should've SEEN her. Waggling that fat arse, BEGGIN' me toâ€”"

"What?" Elara's voice cuts like glass. "Begging you to WHAT?"

I can't look at her. My face is burning. The memory of those wordsâ€”*Please Master Snib, grab my ass*â€”echoes in my skull like a death knell.

"Aldric." Her hand grabs my chin, forces me to meet her eyes. "What did you DO?"

"I..." My throat closes. "I just... I was trying to reduce the debt. Every bit helps, and he said if Iâ€”"

"If she ASKED nice," Snib finishes, still grinning.

Elara's hand drops from my face like I've burned her.

"The bank," I manage. "We should... we should go.")"Least she knows how to WORK," Snib snickers. "Should've seen her scrubbin' me floors yesterday. Naked as the day she was born. All that MEAT just swingin' and bouncin'â€”"

"NAKED?" Elara's voice cracks.

"Had to earn her keep somehow." Snib shrugs. "Can't have her wearin' that pretty armor while she's doin' CHORES, can I? Gets all sweaty. Needed to AIR OUT."

Elara's jaw tightens. Something in her gaze hardens.

"Let's go to the bank," she says flatly. "Now.""She's been earnin' her keep," Snib says, picking at his teeth. "Cleanin', cookin', huntin'. Regular little housewife."

Elara's eyes search my face for somethingâ€”confirmation, denial, I don't know.

"The bank," I say quickly. "If we can get the gold, this ends. That's what matters."

"And ye think I'm just going to LET him go?" Elara's voice shakes. "Hand over everything we've savedâ€”everything we planned for our FUTUREâ€”to this... this..."

Elara stares at him with pure hatred.

Then her shoulders slump.

"Fine." The word is hollow. Dead. "Fine. We'll go to the bank. We'll get your... your GOLD." She spits the word like poison. "And then you'll release my husband."

"That's the deal, missus." Snib tugs my leash. "Nowâ€”let's GO. Daylight's wastin' and I got GOLD to collect."

Elara moves toward the bedroom. "I'm getting her something to WEAR. She can't walk through town inâ€”"

"NAH." Snib yanks the leash hard enough to make me stumble. "She stays in what she's got. I LIKE her outfit. Shows off me property real nice."

"She's not your PROPERTY, she's myâ€”"

"Says so right on her neck." Snib's voice goes cold. Flat. "Nowâ€”we goin' to get me gold, or what?"

Elara's fists clench.

But she walks toward the door.[Choice: Leave.

passages.name: 04 leave for bank
passages.label: Leave For Bank
passages.text:
A woman I don't recognize clutches her child to her skirts as we pass. An old manâ€”I think he sells candles near the fountainâ€”makes a warding sign against evil. Two young men who might have been guards-in-training openly GAWK at my chest, elbowing each other and whispering.

*CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK.*

My heels ring against the cobblestones. Each step makes everything BOUNCE. The breast-band strains. The scale-breeches cling.

Elara walks ahead of us. Spine straight. Head high. Refusing to look back.

But Snib is looking at HER.

His yellow eyes crawl down her back. Find her hips beneath the green dress. Settle on her ass and STAY there.

[Image: But I see Snib looking at HER.

"Nice body, yer wife," he murmurs. Just loud enough for me to hear.

passages.name: 04 response walking to bank
passages.label: Response Walking To Bank
passages.text:
"Keep your EYES off her!"

The words come out before I can stop them.

Elara half-turns.

Snib's grin spreads slowly. His yellow eyes never leave my wife's backside.

"Or WHAT, cow-tits?" He gives my butt a casual squeeze. "Gonna stop me? Gonna MAKE me look somewhere else?" His free hand gestures at my chest. "Cause from where I'm standin', ye ain't got much LEVERAGE."

"She's not part of this. Leave her ALONE."

"Ain't touchin' her, am I? Just LOOKIN'." He scratches his chin. "Though now ye mention it... pretty little thing, yer wife. Them red curls. Them big blue eyes. Bet she'd look REAL nice on her knees."

"You BASTARDâ€”"

He yanks the leash. HARD. I stumble, nearly fall, tits swinging wildly. By the time I catch my balance, Elara has turned fully, watching with horror.

"Everything alright?"

"FINE," Snib answers for me. "Yer husband just gets FEISTY sometimes. Don't worryâ€”I know how to calm her down."

[Image: Right there, in the middle of the street.

His hand finds my ass. Squeezes. Right there, in the middle of the street.

Elara's face goes pale.

"Keep walkin', missus." Snib's voice is cheerful. "We got BANKIN' to do.""Please." The word comes out strangled. "Don't... don't look at her like that."

"Like WHAT?" His grin is innocent. Mocking. "Can't help where me eyes go, can I? Natural instinct. See a pretty female, gotta APPRECIATE."

"She's my WIFE."

[Image: He gives my ass a casual slap.

"And YER me property." He gives my ass a casual slap. "So, that makes her... what? Me property's property? Me ALMOST-property?"

"That's notâ€”"

"Tell ye what." His voice drops to a whisper. Just for me. "Ye shut yer mouth about where I look, or maybe I tell yer precious wifey what ye got up to last night. All that moanin' and groanin' in the hay while SHE was probably cryin' herself to sleep..."

My blood runs cold.

"Didn't THINK so." He pats my hip almost affectionately. "Nowâ€”keep walkin'. And maybe I'll keep me mouth shut about what happened in me hut last night."

I walk.

I don't say another word.

[Choice: You approach the bank.

passages.name: 04 bank approach
passages.label: Bank Approach
passages.text:
For the life we were supposed to have.

Mayor Bramble is coming down the steps as we approach.

He freezes when he sees us. Sweats white.

"Ah. Aldric. I meanâ€”" He mops his forehead with a silk kerchief. "The... situation. Yes. I'm terribly sorry about... everything."

He won't meet my eyes. Won't look at Snib. Won't acknowledge Elara at all.

"Mayor." Fendril's voice comes from behind us. I didn't hear him approach. "A word?"

"I really must be going. Council matters. Very pressing." Bramble is already backing away. "I wish I could do more. Truly. But my hands are..."

He turns and FLEES down a side street.

"What was THAT about?" Snib's eyes narrow.

"Let's find out." Fendril's voice is carefully neutral, but I can see his jaw tighten.

[Image: Inside, the bank is all polished marble and hushed voices.

Inside, the bank is all polished marble and hushed voices. A single teller sits behind iron barsâ€”young, nervous, sweating through his collar. He's got papers spread before him. Official-looking papers with royal seals.

And Fendril's identity parchment. The one that proves I'm Aldric.

"Ah." The teller's voice cracks. "You're... you're here. About the account."

"I want to withdraw ten thousand gold pieces." My voice doesn't shake much. "The verification is right there. I AM Aldric. Fendril confirmed it magically."

The teller swallows. Glances at the papers.

"Yes. The verification is... is valid. Your identity is confirmed." He pauses. "However..."

"However WHAT?" Snib has climbed onto a bench to see over the counter. "She's got gold. She wants gold. GIVE her the gold."

"It's not that simple, sir. When Master Aldric was reported missing three days ago, standard protocol was enacted." The teller's fingers tremble as he points to one of the sealed documents. "Any account holding more than five thousand gold pieces enters a thirty-day verification hold."

The words don't make sense. Then they do.

"Thirty DAYS?"

"It's... it's to prevent claim fraud." The teller won't look at me. "Grave-robbing. Opportunistic theft. When an account holder goes missing, the crown requiresâ€”"

[Image: 'I'm not MISSING! I'm right HERE!'

"I'm NOT missing!" My voice rises. Heads turn throughout the bank. "I'm RIGHT HERE!"

"But you were DECLARED missing three days ago. The hold began then. It cannot be lifted until the full thirty days have passed. That's... that's banking law."

Fendril steps forward. His voice is ice. "I provided magical verification. Soul-markers. PROOF of identity that cannot be falsified."

"Yes, Master Fendril. And the verification will confirm identity at the end of the 30-day period." The teller gestures helplessly at the sealed documents. "But the hold is TIME-BASED. It cannot be overridden. Not by verification. Not by..." He swallows. "Not by anyone."

"Bramble," Fendril breathes.

"The mayor has no sway over the Gilded Charter, sir. This is the King's own decree."

"What does this MEAN?" Snib's voice cuts through. "I want me gold. She's GOT gold. Why can't I HAVE it?"

The teller looks at the goblin like he's seeing a nightmare come to life.

"The account is frozen, sir. For thirty days. Nothing can be withdrawn except..."

"WHY WOULD YE PUT GOLD IN ICE?!" Snib is on his feet now, fangs bared, spittle flying. "WHO FREEZES GOLD?! IT DON'T EVEN MELT! YE STUPID HUMIES AND YER STUPIDâ€”"

"Except what?" Elara's voice cuts through Snib's tirade. "You said EXCEPT. Except what?"

The teller checks his ledger.

"Emergency disbursements. Living expenses." He clears his throat. "Up to fifty gold pieces. Per sennight."

Fifty gold.

*Per sennight.*

"This is ABSURD." Fendril slams his palm on the counter. The teller jumps. "The verification is RIGHT THERE. You KNOW this is Aldric. You KNOWâ€”"

"I know, Master Fendril. I KNOW." The teller's voice breaks. "But I can't... the law is the law. If I release funds against a crown hold, I'll be thrown in the dungeons. My familyâ€”"

"Then get me someone who CAN."

"There IS no one. Not until the thirty days pass. I'm sorry. I'm so sorry."

"TRY HARDER!" Snib is pounding on the counter now. "Make her TRY HARDER! She's supposed to get me GOLD! Not EXCUSES!"

I'm crying again.

Can't help it.

Fifty gold. That's what I can get. After everythingâ€”the transformation, the slavery, the humiliationâ€”fifty gold.

"Give me the fifty," I manage. "Just... give me what you can."

The process takes forever. Forms to sign. Questions to answer. The teller's hands shake as he counts out coinsâ€”real gold, heavy and cold. He pushes them through the bars like they burn him.

Fifty pieces. A pile that would have seemed like a fortune in my younger days.

Now it's nothing.

Fendril storms out without a word. I see his faceâ€”pale, tight, furious at something I don't understand. At himself, maybe. At whatever's really happening here.

Elara hasn't spoken. Her hands are clenched at her sides.[Choice: Leave the bank.

passages.name: 04 selling stuff
passages.label: Selling Stuff
passages.text:
We stumble out of the bank. The fifty coins weigh heavy in the pouch at my hipâ€”a fortune that's NOTHING. Not even a drop in the ocean of what Snib demands.

Snib reaches into the pouches at my waist. I've been carrying his "valuables" like I'm a pack animal. His claws rummage, pulling outâ€”

"Still got me shinies!" He holds up a tarnished brass ring set with what might be glass. "And me sparklies!" A broken comb missing half its teeth. A bent copper bracelet green with verdigris. A necklace of what looks like rat skulls strung on sinew.

Elara stares at the collection.

I watch her face crumble.

"Those are..." She can't finish.

"VALUABLES!" Snib clutches them protectively. "Got 'em off dead humies! And live ones! That ring thereâ€”" He points at the brass circle. "She was CRYIN' when I took it. Means it's IMPORTANT!"

The laugh of someone watching their world collapse into absurdity.

"You're going to sell... RAT SKULLS... to pay off ten thousand gold."

"Ye humies don't understand VALUE!" Snib sounds genuinely offended. "This is prime gobbo merchandise! Got BOOYAGH, these do!"

"Booyagh," Elara repeats flatly.

"MAGIC! POWER! SPARKLE!" Snib waves the broken comb like it's Whisperwind itself. "Any gobbo worth his seed-sacks would trade good shinies for this haul!"

I watch my wife's face cycle through grief, rage, and finallyâ€”

Exhaustion.

"I can't do this," she whispers. And then, louder, already backing away: "I CAN'T. Fifty gold out of ten thousandâ€”some BUREAUCRATICâ€”and he's waving rat skulls around talking about BOOYAGH and I just..."[Choice: Comfort her.

passages.name: 04 elara leaves
passages.label: Elara Leaves
passages.text:
"We can figure this out. We just need to wait thirty daysâ€”"

"THIRTY DAYS." Her voice cracks. "Thirty days of you... of HIM... of..."

She looks at Snib. At his hand on my hip. At the collar around my neck.

At the body that used to be her husband.

"I need to think." She's already turning. "There has to be another way. I'll... I'll talk to people. Find someone who can help. Maybe there's a way to break the hold, orâ€”"

"Elara, WAITâ€”"

But she's gone. Walking fast. Then faster. Almost running.

"Well." Snib tugs at my hip, adjusting his grip. "That went WELL. Yer wife's got a temper, don't she?" He grins up at me. "Reminds me of YOU. Before I broke ye in proper."

passages.name: 04 selling stuff go
passages.label: Selling Stuff Go
passages.text:
I don't respond.

"RIGHT THEN!" He claps his hands together. "Market time! Got SHINIES to sell!"

The guardsâ€”still following, still watchingâ€”exchange glances.

"Lead on, cow-tits. And put some WIGGLE in it. Maybe someone'll pay extra if they like the VIEW.""I am NOT broken in."

Snib's grin doesn't falter.

His hand twitches.

Black metal COILS from the collarâ€”that leash, manifesting from nothing, the end slapping into his waiting palm. He YANKS.

I fold forward. Can't help it. The collar DRAGS me down until my face is level with his, until his rotten breath washes over my lips.

"Not broken, eh?"

His tongueâ€”grey-green, too long, WETâ€”drags across my mouth. A slow, deliberate lick that leaves slime on my lips.

I whimper.

Can't stop it. The sound just comes outâ€”high, pathetic, FEMININE.

Harwick turns away. The younger guard studies his boots.

"Would ALDRIC let me do that?" Snib's voice is a purr. "Would the great HERO stand there and take a gobbo's spit on his pretty lips?"

I can't answer.

"Didn't THINK so." He releases the leash. It dissolves back into the collar like smoke. "Nowâ€”market time! Got SHINIES to sell! And ye'd better put some WIGGLE in them hips, bounce-bags. Maybe someone'll pay extra if they like the VIEW.""She's SICK of you. We ALL are."

Snib's eyes narrow.

Then that horrible grin spreads.

Black metal SPIRALS from my collarâ€”the leash, conjured from nothing. It lands in his palm with a soft clink. He YANKS.

My body jackknifes forward. Tits swing. Hair falls in my face. And suddenly I'm bent double, nose-to-nose with the creature who owns me.

"Sick of ME?" His breath is hot against my lips. "That's CUTE, tit-slave. Real cute."

His tongue slithers out. Drags across my mouth. Slow. WET. Leaving a trail of goblin-spit from corner to corner.

I whimper. The sound escapes before I can stop it.

Harwick's jaw tightens. He looks away. The younger guard finds something fascinating on the ground.

"Know what I think?" Snib's voice drops low. "I think yer wife ain't SICK of me. I think she's SCARED. Scared of how much she might LIKE what I could do to her." He licks my lips again. "Maybe I should show her. Give her a taste of what her husband's been enjoyin'."

"Pleaseâ€”"

"Please WHAT?" He releases the leash. It melts back into the collar. "Please MASTER. Say it."

"...please, Master."

"Better." He pats my cheek with a damp palm. "Nowâ€”market time! Got SHINIES to sell! And put some BOUNCE in them udders, cow-tits. Maybe someone'll pay to watch 'em JIGGLE."[Choice: Walk to the market.

passages.name: 04 market humiliation
passages.label: Market Humiliation
passages.text:
The market square of Eboncrest sprawls before usâ€”merchants hawking wares, children darting between stalls, the smell of fresh bread and horse dung mingling in the afternoon air.

Bought apples from Old Marta's cart. Haggled with Henrik over leather prices. Shared ale with the blacksmith after a successful hunt.

Now I walk them with a goblin's hand on my ass and fifty gold coins that might as well be fifty copper.

"STEP LIVELY!" Snib's voice carries. Heads turn. "Me pet here's got business to conduct!"

The guardsâ€”Harwick and the younger oneâ€”follow at a distance. Their presence is the only thing keeping the crowd from... I don't know. Attacking? Fleeing? Both?

"S'alright, folks!" The younger guard calls out, voice strained. "Town business! They are the mayor's protection!"

Thank the Ephemerals the people still don't know who I am. Unfortunately, the guards do.

First stop: Thom's butcher stall.

I used to buy lamb from Thom every Solstice. He'd save me the good cuts. We'd talk about the weather, about hunting, about whether the winter would be hard.

Now he stares at my chest like he's never seen breasts before.

"I... can I help..." His voice trails off. His eyes don't.

[Image: 'Sir, I'm a BUTCHER.'

"Me pet here's got merchandise!" Snib shoves past me, slapping his "treasures" onto the blood-stained counter. "PRIME goods! Shinies and sparklies! What'll ye give me?"

Thom looks at the rat-skull necklace. The broken comb. The verdigris-crusted bracelet.

"Sir, I'm a BUTCHER."

"So? Ye got COIN, don't ye?"

"I sell MEAT."

"And I'm sellin' THESE!" Snib jabs a finger at the brass ring. "See that? REAL brass! Off a merchant's wife!"

Thom's face goes pale.

"I... I don't think I can help you, sir."

"Fine! FINE!" Snib sweeps his treasures back into my pouches. "Yer loss! These're worth a FORTUNE where I come from! Stupid humie don't know booyagh when he sees it!"

We move on.

Next: Tessa's fabric stall.

She used to mend my cloaks. Patient woman. Kind eyes. Once told me I reminded her of her son who'd gone off to be a soldier.

Now those kind eyes travel down my body with an expression I can't read.

"Well." Her voice is flat. "That's quite the... outfit."

"Ye like her udders?" Snib cups my left breast through the scale-mail, hefting it. "Made 'em meself! Wellâ€”the COLLAR made 'em. But I picked the SIZE! Wanted somethin' I could really GRIP!"

Tessa's face goes red.

"Remove your hand from that woman."

"She ain't a WOMAN, she's me PROPERTY!" But Snib releases me anyway, distracted. "NOWâ€”ye interested in some quality merchandise? Got genuine gobbo artifacts hereâ€”"

He dumps the treasures on her fabric bolts.

Tessa stares at the rat skulls.

"Get those OFF my silk."

"But they're VALUABLE! Look at them little TEETH!"

"They're RAT REMAINS."

"CEREMONIAL rat remains! Got spiritual booyagh in 'em!"

"I'll give you one copper to leave."

Snib's face goes purple.

"ONE COPPER? ONE thrakkingâ€”do ye KNOW what these're worth? I could buy THREE humie cunts with this haul back home! FOUR if they're ugly!"

The guards step closer.

"Perhaps," Harwick says quietly, careful not to upset Snib and cause more of a scene, "we should move along."

We move along.

The pattern repeats at every stall. The jeweler laughs outright at the brass ring. The antiquarian won't even touch the skull necklace. The general goods merchant offers two copper for the lot "out of pity for the poor woman."

By the time we've circled the square, Snib has earned exactly three gold piecesâ€”and those only because Old Marta, who sells apples and has terrible eyesight, thought the verdigris bracelet was "pretty green stone."

"THREE GOLD!" Snib's voice cracks with rage. "Three thrakking GOLD for a FORTUNE in shinies!"

"Master, these things... they're not valuable to humans."

"NOT VALUABLE? Notâ€”" He rounds on me, jabbing a finger at my chest. "Ye humies are STUPID! Ye put gold in ICE! Ye don't understand BOOYAGH! Ye got no TASTE for proper treasure!"

"They're rat skullsâ€”"

"THEY ARE VERY NICE RAT SKULLS!"

His hand whips out.

*CRACK.*

Palm against my ass. In public. In the market square of my home town.

The sound ECHOES.

Heads turn. Conversations stop. Someone gasps.

My face burns.

"Ye'd better figure out how to make these SELL!" Snib snarls. "Or I'll find other ways to earn me gold. Maybe yer WIFE would like to help instead."

"Don't." The word tears from my throat.

He grabs my collar. Yanks me down to his level.

"I'll THINK whatever I want, cow-tits." His breath washes over my face. Rotten. Hot. "I'm the MASTER here. And yer the one who can't even sell a simple pile of shinies."

He releases me. I stumble.

The guards watch. The crowd watches. Everyone watches.

My ass stings. My cheeks burn. And a three-foot goblin holds the world in his warty fist.

"Market's a WASTE." Snib spits on the cobblestones. "Stupid humies and their stupid 'not valuable' and their stupid ICE-GOLD. Where's a gobbo supposed to get a DRINK in this thrakking town?"[Choice: 'The Silver Stag.'

passages.name: 04 silver stag
passages.label: Silver Stag
passages.text:
The Silver Stag crouches at the corner of Market Street and Ironmonger's Lane like it's been there since before streets had names. Timber and fieldstone, smoke-darkened beams, a stuffed stag's head above the door with glass eyes that seem to judge everyone who enters.

I've walked through that door so many times. After hunts. After battles. After burying friends.

Now my heel catches on the threshold and I nearly sprawl face-first into the sawdust.

*CLOP-stumble-CLINK.*

The scale-mail catches me, the breast-band cutting into my ribs as I pitch forward. I grab the doorframe with fingers that are too small, too soft, utterly *wrong*, and haul myself upright.

Behind me, Snib cackles.

"Graceful, cow-tits. REAL graceful."

Forty faces turn. Forty expressions shift from evening relaxation to something harder. The Silver Stag on a regular night is rough men drinking rough drinks - miners, smiths, off-duty soldiers, merchants who've had a long road. The kind of crowd that Aldric could navigate in his sleep.

Elise is something else.

Forty pairs of eyes drop straight to my chest and stick there.

And behind me, *waddling* through the door like he owns the placeâ€”

"OI!" Snib's voice cuts through the silence like a rusty knife. "I want me FAVORITE drink! The... the BLUE one! With the BUBBLES!"

He's making shit up. Trying to seem *worldly*.

The barman - *Gorm*, my mind supplies, Gorm who served under Aldric's command at one time, Gorm whose leg I splinted after the cavalry charge - sets down the tankard he's polishing with deliberate slowness.

"No greenskins." His voice is gravel on granite.

"What's THAT?" Snib cups a warty hand to his ear. "Didn't catch that, humie. Speak UP."

"I saidâ€”" Gorm's scarred face goes dark. "No. Greenskins. In. My. Establishment."

The crowd stirs. Someone at a back table stands. Then another. I recognize faces - Henrik's boy, the one from the market. Old Thom who runs the leather stall. The blacksmith's apprentice, big as a barn door.

"Guards said to let 'em through!" someone calls from near the door. That's Harwick's voice, but he sounds distant, overwhelmed. "Mayor's orders!"

"Mayor ain't HERE," another voice growls. "And neither is Aldric, thanks to fucking GOBLINS!"

The name hits like a crossbow bolt.

*Aldric.*

My eyes find the wall behind the bar. There, among the trophies and the mounted antlers and the faded paintings of hunts gone by, hangs a row of tankards. Regulars' tankards, kept on pegs. And third from the leftâ€”

*ALDRIC THE GREAT* carved into the handle.

"Heroes don't just VANISH," Gorm says, and his voice has gone quiet and dangerous. "Not Aldric. Something happened to him. Something *green*."

"Oi, that's GOOD wood!" Snib pipes up, apparently spotting the tankard too. He waddles forward - the crowd parting from him like he carries plague - and points. "That'd make a nice piss-pot, that would!"

The crowd SNARLS.

I should say something. I should *do* something. But my voice has abandoned me, my throat tight against the collar, and all I can do is stand here in my ridiculous armor while these men - men I *fought* beside, men I *saved* - look at me like I'm some goblin'sâ€”

A tankard flies.

*CLANG.*

It catches Snib on the shoulder, splattering ale. He yelps - more surprise than pain - and the crowd surges forward.

"GET THAT GREENSKINâ€”"

"â€”for ALDRICâ€”"

"â€”string him UPâ€”"

Harwick is shouting something. The younger guard is trying to push people back. But there are too many, and the rage is too hot, and somewhere in the chaos a hand grabs my breast - *squeezes* - releases before I can even screamâ€”

"ENOUGH."

The voice cuts through the riot like a cleaver through fat.

Everything stops.

From the shadows of the corner booth, a shape rises. And rises. And keeps *rising*.

Rolls of fat spill over his straining belt. His fleshy face glistens with the permanent sheen of a man who hasn't seen sober in years. Small, piggish eyes squint through the haze of pipe smoke and spilled ale.

I know this man.

I *put* this man in chains.

"Now, now," Grimjaw rumbles, and his voice is gravel wrapped in rendered fat. "Can't you see this fine goblin gentleman is under *official guard supervision*?" He lumbers forward, and the crowd parts for him too - but differently than they parted for Snib. They part like men clearing the path for something *dangerous*. "I'm sure there's a perfectly reasonable explanation for..."

His eyes find me.

Travel down.

"...all of this," he finishes, and his smile spreads like rot across bread.

Behind me, Snib's grip finds my hip. His claws dig in through the scale-mail.

passages.name: 04 grimjaw approach
passages.label: Grimjaw Approach
passages.text:
The name leaves my mouth before I can stop it.

Grimjaw's piggish eyes go wide. Then narrow. Thenâ€”

That *smile*. That spreading, rotting, delighted smile.

"Well, well, WELL." He rocks back on his heels, belly wobbling, and lets out a laugh that sounds like grease popping in a pan. "Now HOW would a pretty little thing like YOU know old Thaddeus by name?" He turns to the crowd, arms spread wide. "Boys! This fine lady KNOWS me! Ain't that something!"

The crowd mutters. I feel the heat rising in my face. *Stupid. STUPID.* How would some random goblin's slave know the name of Eboncrest's most notorious criminal? Unlessâ€”

"Maybe ye met in a PREVIOUS life," Snib cackles, and his hand tightens on my hip. "Me pet here's got all SORTS of interesting history." His yellow eyes find mine, gleaming with malicious amusement. He's not going to tell. He's going to watch me *squirm*.

Grimjaw leans in close. His breath washes over me - sour wine and rotting teeth and underneath it all, a cloying sweetness like perfumed rot. "Previous life," he repeats, slowly. "Now THAT'S interesting." His eyes travel down to the collar at my throat. "That's OLD magic, that is. Pre-human, I'd wager." Back up to my face. "Where'd your little master find such a *prize*?"

I say nothing. My jaw is clenched so tight my teeth ache.

"Ah, she's the QUIET type!" Grimjaw booms, and claps a meaty hand on my shoulder. The weight of it makes my knees buckle slightly. "I LIKE that in a woman. Come, come - let me buy you both a drink! Any enemy of *proper society*â€”" he gestures at the still-hostile crowd, "â€”is a friend of old Greasegut!"]I keep my mouth shut. Every instinct screams at me to stay small, stay silent, stay *invisible*.

"Cat got your tongue, sweetheart?" He chuckles, a wet sound. "That's alright. Plenty of time for talking." His gaze drops to the collar, lingers there. "That's OLD magic, that is. Pre-human, I'd wager." He looks at Snib. "Where'd you find such a *prize*, little friend?"

"Found 'er in a HOLE!" Snib announces proudly. "Underground hole! Full of OLD stuff! She was just WAITIN' there for a proper master to come along!"

"Is that so." Grimjaw's smile doesn't reach his eyes. "Something FAMILIAR about you, girl. Can't quite put my finger on it." He taps his chin with a sausage-thick finger. "Well. No matter. Come, come - let me buy you both a drink! Any creature that makes these *fine citizens*â€”" he sweeps an arm at the glowering crowd, "â€”so uncomfortable is a friend of old Greasegut!"

He herds us toward the corner booth like a shepherd with particularly reluctant sheep. His bulk creates a path through the crowd - men who were ready to tear Snib apart moments ago now shrink back from Grimjaw's passage. I catch glimpses of faces. Disgust. Fear. But also *deference*.

*When did he get so powerful?* I think, dimly. *He was nothing but a two-copper extortionist when we first met.*

The booth is tucked into the darkest corner of the Silver Stag, away from the fire, away from the windows. The leather seats are cracked and stained with things I don't want to identify. Grimjaw slides into one side with a grunt, his belly pressing against the table edge.

Snib scrambles up onto the opposite bench.

Which leaves me standing.

"Sit DOWN, cow-tits," Snib commands, patting the seat beside him. "Ye're makin' a SCENE."

I slide in next to the goblin. The bench is too low - clearly made for human men, not women in ridiculous heeled boots - and my knees press up against the underside of the table. My tits rest on the wooden surface like they're being served on a platter.

Grimjaw's eyes fix on them immediately.

"GORM!" he bellows, not looking away from my chest. "Three of your finest! And keep 'em coming!"

From across the tavern, Gorm's face is a mask of barely-contained fury. But he reaches for bottles anyway. Whatever hold Grimjaw has on this town, even the barman isn't immune.

"Now then." Grimjaw settles back, wooden seat creaking dangerously. "Let's get *acquainted*."[Choice: Endure the conversation.

passages.name: 04 grimjaw drinks
passages.label: Grimjaw Drinks
passages.text:
The drinks arrive in quick succession. Gorm sets them down without a word, his scarred face carefully blank, though I catch his eyes lingering on my collar before he retreats.

"Ironwood stout!" Grimjaw announces, pushing a tankard of something black as pitch toward Snib. "Put hair on your balls, that will." He laughs at his own joke, belly wobbling.

Snib sniffs it suspiciously. "Smells like TREES."

"Pine-resin! Burns going down, warms the belly. Go on, try it!"

Snib takes a sip. His face contorts through several expressions - disgust, surprise, something approaching pleasure. "S'not BAD," he admits. "Got KICK to it."

"THAT'S the spirit!" Grimjaw pushes another tankard toward him. "Now THIS - this is Widow's Comfort. Honey mead. Sweet as sin, but don't let that fool you. Named for how many wives it's helped through the *grieving process*." He winks at me. "If you take my meaning."

My stomach isn't doing well. I take a sip of my own drink - something amber that burns - just to have something to do with my hands.

"And THIS beautyâ€”" Grimjaw produces a dark bottle with a flourish, "â€”is Thornback whiskey. Made from fermented thornberries, aged in charred oak. Reserved for *serious* drinkers." He pours three small glasses. "To new friendships!"

Snib downs his in one gulp. Coughs. His eyes water.

"HRUK! That's got some THRAKKING BOOYAGH in it!"

"Don't know what that means, but I'll take it as a compliment!" Grimjaw is already pouring another round. "Now then, little friend. Tell old Greasegut about yourself. What brings a goblin and his..." his eyes slide to me, "*pet*... to our fair town?"

"GOLD!" Snib announces, already reaching for the mead. "Ten thousand gold! That's what she OWES me!"

Grimjaw's eyebrows rise into his sweating hairline. "Ten *thousand*? That's quite a sum." His piggish eyes fix on me with new interest. "How would a slave-girl have access to such wealth?"

I feel Snib's hand find my thigh under the table. Squeeze.

"She's got her WAYS," he says, with a grin that shows all his broken teeth. "Ain't that right, bounce-bags?"

I nod, not trusting my voice.

"Mysterious." Grimjaw seems delighted by this. He leans back, cradling his whiskey. "You know, I've always admired your kind."

Snib blinks. "Ye WHAT?"

"Goblins. Always admired them." Grimjaw takes a long drink. "See, folks around here would call you monsters. Vermin. But I've always seen something *honest* in your people." He gestures with his glass. "You see something you want, you TAKE it. No pretense. No courtship. No lies. Just..." his eyes find my chest again, "...*appetite*. There's something PURE about that."

"Damn RIGHT there is!" Snib slaps the table. "Finally, a humie what GETS it!"

"Oh, I get it." Grimjaw's smile spreads. "I get it very well indeed." He leans forward, voice dropping conspiratorially. "Tell me - is it true what they say? About goblin... *breeding* practices?"

Snib puffs up. "What do they SAY?"

"That you keep women. Dozens of them. Breeding pens." Grimjaw actually *shivers*. "That you use them until they're *broken*, then trade them to other tribes. That a single goblin male can father hundreds of offspring if he's got enough..."â€”his eyes drop below the tableâ€”"...*equipment*."

I wrap them around the tankard instead.

"Oh, that's all TRUE!" Snib is warming to his audience. "Back in me old tribe - before I struck out on me OWN, mind - we had us a proper warren! Twenty females, easy! Some of 'em human, some of 'em Telenil, even had a dwarf once!" He scratches his chin. "She was a SCREAMER, that one."

"Fascinating." Grimjaw pours more whiskey. "And your pet hereâ€”" he nods at me, "â€”she satisfies your... *needs*?"

Under the table, Snib's hand creeps higher on my thigh. I clench my jaw.

"She's LEARNIN'," he says. "Bit stubborn at first. Thought she was TOO GOOD for a gobbo like me." His claws dig in through the scale-breeches. "Had to show her the TRUTH of things."

"Ah, they always think they're too good at first." Grimjaw's voice has gone dreamy, remembering. "I had one like that once. Pretty little thing. Worked at the bakery on Temple Street." His eyes unfocus. "Thought she was too good to pay her father's debts. Thought being PRETTY meant rules didn't apply to her."

*Jenna.* My blood runs cold. *He's talking about Jenna.*

"So I took her out back." Grimjaw takes a long drink. "Right there in the alley behind the bakery. In the FILTH, where she belonged. Her daddy owed me forty silver and she was gonna work off every COPPER."

I remember finding her. Barely conscious behind those flour sacks.

"Course, that was before some HERO decided to stick his nose where it didn't belong." Grimjaw's voice goes hard. "Aldric the 'GREAT.' Saint fucking Aldric, savior of every slut too stupid to keep her legs closed." He spits on the floor. "Put me away for three years. THREE YEARS, for what? Teaching some jumped-up baker's daughter her PLACE?"

I feel Snib's eyes on me. Feel his grin widening.

"This ALDRIC," he says, slowly. "He sounds like a real ARSEHOLE."

"The WORST." Grimjaw drains his glass. "But he's GONE now, isn't he? Went into those mines and never came back. Some say the goblins got him." He raises his glass toward Snib. "To the goblins, then! For doing what I never could!"

Snib cackles and clinks his tankard against Grimjaw's glass.

My hands are shaking. I grip my drink to hide it.

"You know..." Grimjaw is studying me again. "There's something about your pet, little friend. Something FAMILIAR. The way she holds herself. The way she looks at me like she wants to tear my throat out." He chuckles. "I've seen that look before."

"Have ye NOW?" Snib's voice is silk over broken glass.

"Mmm." Grimjaw's eyes narrow. "Can't quite place it. But I KNOW I've seen those eyes somewhere." He leans forward. "What's your name, sweetheart?"

The table goes quiet.

Snib's hand is on my thigh again. I can feel the amusement radiating off him like heat from a forge. He's not going to tell. He wants to watch me choose. He's fucking enjoying this.

)Grimjaw's smile widens. "You already knew my name, didn't you? Before anyone said it. HOW, I wonder?"]Grimjaw's smile widens. "Come now. I won't bite. Not unless you ASK nicely."

passages.name: 04 reveal choice
passages.label: Reveal Choice
passages.text:
Something snaps inside me.

Maybe it's the whiskey. Maybe it's watching this pig reminisce about assaulting Jenna like it was a fond memory. Maybe it's three days of swallowing my pride and calling a three-foot goblin "Master."

Whatever it is, I'm done.

"You want to know who I am?" My voice comes out steady. Cold. "I'm Aldric."

Grimjaw blinks.

"I'm the one who found Jenna bleeding behind those flour sacks. I'm the one who dragged you out of that alley by your hair. I'm the one who BROKE YOUR ARM when you tried to run." I lean forward, and something of the old fire must show in my eyes because Grimjaw actually leans back. "I put you in that cell, Grimjaw. And when I get free of this collar, I'll do it AGAIN."

Silence.

Then Grimjaw starts to laugh.

It builds slowly - a wheeze, a chortle, then a full-bellied roar that shakes his entire massive frame. Tears stream down his fleshy cheeks. He pounds the table with his fist, making the drinks jump.

"ALDRIC!" he howls. "Aldric the GREAT! Saint fucking ALDRIC!" He gestures at my body - the tits, the hips, the collar. "And now LOOK at you! Sitting in MY booth, in MY town, as some goblin's FUCKTOY!"

Snib is cackling too, listing slightly in his seat. The whiskey has loosened something in himâ€”made his movements sloppier, his grin wider. "HARHARHAR! I was WONDERIN' when she'd crack!"

"Oh, this is PRECIOUS." Grimjaw wipes his eyes. "The hero of Eboncrest. The man who broke my arm." He reaches across the table andâ€”before I can reactâ€”grabs one of my breasts through the scale-mail. SQUEEZES. "These are the tits of my NEMESIS! Oh, the GODS have a sense of humor!"

I slap his hand away. The sound cracks through the tavern.

Grimjaw only laughs harder.

"Feisty! Still got some fight in you!" He settles back, still chuckling. "But tell me something, ALDRICâ€”" He says my name like it's the funniest joke he's ever heard. "â€”this collar. Is it PERMANENT? Are you stuck like this FOREVER?"

"Till I get me GOLD," Snib announces, swaying slightly as he reaches for more whiskey. "Ten thousan'. Then maybeâ€”MAYBEâ€”I let her go." He grins at me, broken teeth gleaming. "Maybe."

"Ten thousand gold." Grimjaw whistles low. "And if you DON'T get the gold?"

"Then she stays MINE." Snib's voice goes hard despite the slur creeping into it. "Forever and EVER. Me personal cocksleeve."

Grimjaw shudders. Actually *shudders*.

"Beautiful," he breathes. "Absolutely BEAUTIFUL." His piggish eyes find mine, bright with malice. "And what about that pretty little wife of yours? Elara, wasn't it? The herbalist?" He grins. "She must be LOVING this. Her big strong husband turned intoâ€”" He waves at my chest. "â€”THIS. Bet she can't WAIT to watch you get mounted by your new master."

The words hit like a blade between the ribs.

"Don't you DAREâ€”"

"Oh, I'm not gonna DO anything." Grimjaw raises his hands in mock innocence. "I'm just IMAGINING. Poor sweet Elara. Waiting at home. Wondering where her hero went." He leans forward. "And then he comes BACK. Only he's not a hero anymore. He's a big-titted breeding sow for a three-foot GOBLIN."

Snib cackles, nearly spilling his drink. "She CRIED! Ye shoulda SEEN her face!"

"I BET she did!" Grimjaw is wiping tears again. "Oh, this is too GOOD. The great Aldric, brought low. And his WIFE gets to watch!"

His meaty hand shoots across the table again. This time I'm not fast enough.

*WHAP.*

He slaps my tit. Open-palmed. Hard enough to send it bouncing sideways into its twin. The impact makes a wet *clap* that seems to echo through the whole tavern.

"ALDRIC!" he bellows, laughing as my breast wobbles. "Remember when you broke my arm? Remember how I SCREAMED?"

*WHAP.*

The other one. Left-handed. My tits crash together and separate, jiggling wildly.

"This is REVENGE, you sanctimonious CUNT!"

*WHAP. WHAP. WHAP.*

He's slapping them like drums now, alternating hands, making them bounce and swing and collide. Each impact sends shockwaves through my chest. The scale-cups can barely contain them. I grab at his wrists but his arms are like tree trunksâ€”meaty, heavy, impossible to move.

"Go ON then!" Snib urges, nearly falling off his seat with laughter. "Give 'em a good WALLOP! She can take it!"

*WHAP. WHAP.*

"Look at them GO!" Grimjaw crows. "Best tits in Eboncrest and they belong to the man who put me in a CELL!"

"STOP!" I finally wrench backward, breaking his grip. My chest is heaving, my face burning, my slapped breasts aching inside their metal cups.

Grimjaw settles back, still chuckling, flexing his meaty fingers.

"Still got some fight. I LIKE that." He pours more whiskeyâ€”his hand only slightly unsteady. "But let me tell you something, ALDRIC. Whatever you were? That's GONE now. You're not a hero anymore. You're not even a MAN." His eyes drop to my chest, still bouncing from my ragged breathing. "You're a set of holes attached to the biggest pair of tits I've ever seen. And I'm going to ENJOY watching what happens next."

Snib tugs at my arm, pulling me back down onto the bench. "Settle DOWN, cow-tits. Ye've had yer fun." But his yellow eyes are gleaming with satisfaction. He LOVED this. Me revealing myself, being mocked, being *reduced*.

"So." Grimjaw leans forward again, voice dropping conspiratorially. "Have you FUCKED her yet?"

The question hangs in the smoky air.

"Has the great ALDRICâ€”" Grimjaw savors each word, "â€”the hero of Eboncrest, the slayer of monsters, the rescuer of MAIDENSâ€”" He pounds the table, making my tits bounce where they've settled on the wood. "â€”has he been FUCKED by goblin cock?"

Snib grins that horrible grin. "I'm a patient gobbo, me. I like to break 'em in SLOW." His clawed hand finds my thigh under the table. Squeezes. "She's been... *warming up* to the idea."
